title: Looking for the impossible... Love and Adventure
text:
My favorite hobby is getting lost.I'm an avid traveler and I love adventures in new cities. The very first thing I do after putting my luggage to rest at whatever place in staying, is to get hopelessly lost. I step out into the city and walk, just walk and see and experience the place.I keep walking until I'm completely lost, then, I find my way back again.I've been doing it this way alone. I'm hoping to change that. I'm hoping to find my adventure partner. I have a good job and my own place. I play music in a band. I paint. I love everything creative. I devour books and movies. I smoke cigarettes and love long late night conversations over good beer. The darker and more bitter the better. I'm new to Colorado, I'm from here, but I've spent the better part of a decade away from home. Its strange being back, I feel like a tourist.

I'm looking for an adventure partner. send a picture and a bit about yourself.

title: So Why Am I on CL??
text:
I'm a Good Man. . .with an unfortunate defect - I don't have enough hair on my head. And being painfully aware of how much ladies value hair on a Gentleman's head, I understand my lack of success in the dating game.

However disappointing this reality may be, it's more disappointing for me to see so many women struggling to find a decent man in any forum, be it CL, a bar, or other. . . When I am a good man with so much to offer the one gal willing to take a chance on me. 

Yes, I don't have enough hair on my head, but I have a great deal to offer:

- the 3 "s's"- single, straight, solvent
- tallness - 6'-3.75"
- fitness and activity - 187#. . . viewed in certain lights, I'm confident I have a nice body
- blue eyes and sandy colored hair with a fair complexion
- employed architect (licensed professional) & industrial designer
- intelligence - summa graduate at the top of my class from the top program in my field 
- northern born, bred, and values, from a stable family with great parents
- honesty in all things
- humor, wit, & humility
- patience, compassion, & understanding
- decisiveness & imagination
- well traveled & experienced abroad
- open minded to all races, faiths, & ideas
- healthy & disease free
- especially drama free. . . no skeletons in my closet, crazy exes, or criminal past
- a willingness to be friends, engage in an LTR, or just appreciate the chance to have a conversation

The list could continue, but at the risk of being obnoxious, I'll keep it short. . . Should there be any young ladies (aged 32 or lower) interested in getting to know me, despite my unfortunate aesthetic encumbrance, I would enjoy the opportunity to reward your good faith.

title: Are You MARRIED and thinking about placing an ad BUT...

Let me try to save you some of that hassle and risk... 

I am guessing you have been married or in a relationship for a long time. The romance has evaporated. Passion - what's that? Hell, even the sex is routine if it exists at all. You are more like business partners or roommates. But there are so many responsibilities and obligations... 

You long to feel noticed, appreciated and respected for all you do. You need to feel wanted and desired for the intelligent, sexy, sensuous woman you know you still are. A bar pick up or one night stand isn't you. Sure you miss the kissing that makes your toes curl and the great sex but it isn't just that. You miss the deep connection, the comfort, the affection, the sharing, the feeling of being excited and of being able to arouse a special someone that you want to please. You want to relax and laugh and be happy and free at least for a private moment. You would love to feel warm and anxious with anticipation of our next message, call or meeting. You want to be a woman who is alive. 

I understand and share these feelings and longings. I, too, find myself in 'that' kind of marriage. I am also not willing to risk everything on a cheap fling but rather seek a very special, intelligent, mature woman who has considered an adult friendship and a lover. title: FLR Primer
text:
Time for a relationship change? 
How about a change of perspective on what a relationship can be - and should be. 
Maybe you'd prefer a man on your terms - one who is eager to please and attentive to your needs. 
Such men exist. I'm one of them: devotional, deferential and proudly submissive. 
Women routinely reject deferential, devotional and eager-to-please men out of ignorance rather than insight. They mistakenly believe men, who happily defer to strong women, are inherently unworthy. The reality is, we're quite the opposite and offer an alternative to the pervasive machismo endemic in our patriarchal society. 

What does such a relationship entail? As an unapologetic, 'card-carrying submissive male' - who has been in a number of FLRs (Female-led Relationships) - I have some insight into what makes men, like me, tick.

title: Does my soulmate happen to be living in the Denver area?
text:
Hello ladies! I realize this ad is long but if you're looking for the same thing I am, it should be appreciated instead of an inconvenience. The more you can learn about me upfront, the better. Especially, when it comes to the most important things. What I'm looking for is my future wife, plain and simple and I don't care how far and wide I have to search in order to find her! I have finally reached the stage in my life where I realize that there's nothing more important on earth than waking up every morning with the person you're supposed to be with. That would make this journey so much more fulfilling and definitely easier than tackling the world on your own. Don't get me wrong here, I'm not trying to run out and elope tomorrow because I'm a little more patient and realistic than that! Relationships take time to develop and futures have to be carefully planned out but I do want someone who's looking for something permanent like I am and is willing to take a chance. Some would say that Craigslist is the last place a person should hope to find their soulmate but why not? You're on here, I'm on here and doesn't everyone else who gets on here shop at the same grocery stores we do? With that being said, who cares where you meet someone as long as you're compatible? We can always tell our friends and family that we bumped into each other at Safeway!

I'm starting this off by listing 5 categories that include my "must haves" in a relationship. I'm looking for someone who's on the same page with ALL of them and I can't settle for anything less. This is about finding someone to spend the rest of my life with so we will need to be firing on all cylinders. I truly believe that if we agree on the whole 1-5 list, we will have a great chance of succeeding but I also believe if just one of them are missing, we won't stand a chance. I don't know about you but I'm tired of wasting years of my life with the wrong partners. I'm either looking to hit the jackpot this time around or go home empty handed!

#1. COMMUNICATION - This is at the very top of my list. I don't care how attracted you are to each other, how much you have in common or how great the chemistry is between you. If you can't problem solve, your relationship has no where to go. It's as simple as that. What this requires is having the ability to communicate what's wrong in a tactful manner, the willingness to compromise and a forgiving spirit whenever problems arise because you can rest assure they will! Those who can't do this end up being single or in and out of relationships their entire lives. There's absolutely no room for selfish thinking when there's another person to consider. Some people actually think it's cool to be stubborn but on the contrary, it's a good way to find yourself alone in the end. 

#2. AFFECTION - I tried to be in a relationship before where the woman was non-affectionate and that doesn't work for me. Human touch is a beautiful thing and it can be a lonely world without it. I love to hug, kiss, cuddle and feel close to the person I'm with. I'm not talking about smothering your partner or attaching yourself to them like glue because everyone needs their personal space, but it's nice to come home to someone who will wrap their arms around you when you've had a long, exhausting day!

#3. SEX - I think it's safe to say that I'm definitely not like most men in this area! For one thing, I don't have much of an interest in strip clubs, porn or dirty magazines which eliminates at least 50% of the male population! However, if those things turn my lady on, I'll be happy to explore them with her but never on my own. I also don't cheat or desire other women when I already have one. That takes care of the other 50%! In addition to that, I am a pleaser who's totally unselfish in bed. To give you an idea, there have been times when I made a girl cum 2 or 3 times but then stopped without taking care of myself because she was finished and I didn't want to overdo it! The thing that gets me excited is knowing that my lady is finding pleasure. This is why I'm not possessive, jealous or controlling either. In fact, I'm the exact opposite. Your average guy would flip out if his wife told him that she's attracted to another man and wants to have sex with him but not me! Just bringing that to my attention would instantly turn me on and I would be happy to reward her for her honesty! It took me years to figure this out about myself and then I had to learn to accept it but now that I have, I want this to be a part of my future with someone! Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking for a girl who's going to be promiscuous and sleep with everyone who comes along but I would definitely let her fuck a guy that she was hot for and wanted badly! I'd also be open to letting her have a "friend with benefits" as a regular that she can bring home from time to time for extra fun. As long as there were no pregnancies, diseases or emotional attachments, I'd have no problem with it whatsoever! Honesty is the key here and if everything is out in the open, there would be no reason for lying or cheating to enter the picture.

#4. QUALITY TIME - I don't understand couples who live under the same roof and merely co-exist together. They barely even talk to each other and just go through the motions every day like robots. The woman is usually multitasking with a cell phone attached to her ear as she's making dinner and yelling at the kids to quiet down while the man is drinking a beer and watching the game with a friend. This is just an analogy but you get the point. By the time the evening is over, they haven't spent one second of quality time together all day long. This goes on month after month, year after year and then they can't figure out how their marriage failed! Although having nights like that is expected, there also needs to be a balance. The typical "ho hum" attitude doesn't work for me and it just isn't in my DNA. I'm a passionate person who likes to go out and do things that are fun with the lady I'm sharing my life with and I also need to feel a strong connection there as well. The whole purpose for me is to have a best friend, a partner and a companion who I'm deeply in love with, not just a roommate. To maintain this, you have to be creative at times to keep the fire going in your relationship or the flame will die out. Nothing runs on automatic pilot.

#5. TEAMWORK - I don't believe in gender roles. Just because I'm a man doesn't mean I can't shop or that my woman can't mow the lawn. I have never agreed with that old fashioned philosophy. I think the responsibilities should be divvied up according to who's better at what. That's how your household will run smoother and more efficiently. Then, whatever is left over is either done together or you take turns. Teamwork is about defending each other as well. This means when someone is talking shit behind my back, you speak out and stand up for me. Some women will just sit there and let the person carry on without ever saying a word or they'll even join in! That's not right and you'll never have to worry about that on my end because I don't tolerate people saying negative things about my woman, especially to my face. Teamwork also applies to finances. You both contribute to the bills but you also carry each other through tough times. I hate to say it but that means if I lose my job, you'll step up and support the household until I can find something else (without giving me a hard time about it) just like I would do for you. It's bad enough to be unemployed. The last thing you need is your significant other making it worse for you. Relationships are a partnership and there are enough people in the world that don't care about you so the least you can do is care for one another. I've been with women in the past who moved in with me and didn't pay a thing for months which no one had a problem with but the rare times when I needed to lean on my lady, I got treated like shit and reminded every day of how she's not going to support her man. To sum it up, selfish women like that have no place in my life.

Well, that is my 1-5 list. If we're on the same page, I would love to hear your comments on all of them. Please include that with your response in as much detail as you can. The list doesn't cover everything because how you live, what your personal goals are, habits, pet peeves, etc. are very important to know as well but this is a great start. Also, I have listed some my personal interests below so maybe you can tell me what we have in common in this area too...

Camping, fishing (a big plus!), Kayaking (I own two of them), singing karaoke, going on long drives and taking photos of the scenic areas, snuggling and watching a good movie (especially in the winter months), cooking, having BBQ's & trying new restaurants, playing board games. going to the zoo and the aquarium, checking out a comedy club, doing light gambling at the casino and eating at their buffet, going to the mall around Christmas time, spending the day at a state fair or an outdoor event, listening to music, watching a good ballgame, going to museums and international emporiums, etc. 

Finally, I used to have an age preference but now I'm not sure what I want! I'm attracted to younger girls but then I have to put up with the games and immaturity. Especially with sex. They're still using it to get things in life like a promotion, a guy with money or a baby for themselves and they haven't figured out yet that it's fun and feels good! The older women understand that completely so the sex is there without all the BS but then you have to put up with the stubbornness, how set in their ways they are and the bitter taste they still have from their former marriages. The younger women are more open about planning a future together because they have a whole life ahead of them but it's hard to relate to this era concerning the styles, the lingo, the mentality and the music. The older women are from a generation that hits home so you have that in common but you can forget having a future with them because they already have their car, their house, their career, their children, etc. and they want to keep it all to themselves! It's a crap shoot but if I were to pick a side, I would either have to go with a younger woman who has an old soul or a woman my age who looks young! The only real preference I have is that I'm not interested in heavyset girls. That includes the term "thick" as well. I prefer short and petite the most but tall and thin is great too and I don't care if small breasts go along with that! I just like women who look feminine. There's also nothing wrong with an average build so don't get me wrong there. I'm just pointing out what body types turn me on the most because I've been asked that before. Also, just because I have a preference doesn't mean you should expect a male model here! I consider myself a mediocre looking guy but I do believe that I have above average qualities. I'm 38 years old, 6ft tall, on the stocky side (sorry, no 6-pack abs or tats), semi-dark complected and I have neatly trimmed facial hair. I'm willing to send you my photos upon seeing yours. If we're attracted to each other and we agree on my 1-5 as well, I would LOVE to hear from you and take it from there!


Here are some funny one liners for you to enjoy...

I hAtE wHeN pEoPLE tYpE lIkE tHiS.
Going to McDonald's for a salad is like going to a whore for a hug.
I redo high fives when they're not good enough the first time around.
I hate when I'm yelling at someone and I mess up what I'm saying.
Fighting for peace is like fucking for virginity.
I get this urge to smile when someone is yelling at me.
Sex is not the answer, sex is the question. Yes, is the answer! 
Your story doesn't add up so feel free to stop lying anytime now.
I love it when a person's laugh is funnier than the joke.
I forgot your name so I'm waiting for someone else to say it.
I like changing a word when I can't spell the one I really want to use.
Virginity is like a soap bubble. One little prick and it's gone!

title: SAVE ME!!!
text:
I would consider myself one of the nicest guys out there. I have a lot going for me career-wise, but have never had any luck with my personal life. For the last 5 years, I have been completely alone. No friends and a non-existent love life. I mean I am in shape, well-dressed, smell great, and not horrible to look at. I just can't understand how I can be so alone. 

When I go out in public I don't see anyone else by himself or herself. I mean everybody says that you shouldn't try to force a relationship. . . things will just work out. But what if they don't? I have been content being single and have even acquired a number of hobbies over the years. The problem is at a certain point you can't be content being alone. Nobody is meant to go through life alone and I honestly don't know what to do anymore. Lately I haven't been able to sleep much. Just can't stop thinking about how alone I am and how much I crave companionship. I just feel like I'm wasting my life away and as hard as I try to put myself out there and meet people, nothing seems to work out for me. It's been hard pulling myself out of bed in the morning because I feel like I have nothing to look forward to. I'm stuck in the same routine and I want more.

I also can't take the lack of physical contact. I'm not the kind of guy who sleeps around. To be honest, I have only been with one woman. I haven't even kissed a woman in the last 5 years and it has been killing me. I mean I should be a desirable man. I am in shape and relatively attractive. 

I just don't think anyone knows what being alone for as long as I have does to a person. I don't think I'm asking for much. . . I just want one good woman to be there for me. I need someone to save me from the nightmare that has been the last 5 years of my life.

I'm sure you think I'm crazy at this point, but if you are still reading and think you can help, I'd enjoy hearing from you. Put "Things will get better" in the subject line so I can weed out spam.

title: Gamer girl or nerd girl wanted for FWB
text:
I have always been a gamer and a bit of a nerd, and I would like to meet a girl with similar interests to spend some time with. I'm not looking for any specific type of relationship as I'd rather just get to know each and do what feels naturally. We could wind up being friends, in a serious relationship, FWB, or archenemies...hopefully not the last one. I added all those "helpful details" that CL now allows, but a little more about myself:

I am generally a happy person and feel there is no bad time for jokes, and I tend to have a very sarcastic sense of humor. I am very much a night owl and keep crazy hours. While I am a nerd, I still enjoy going out and am up for just about anything (except roller coasters) that seems fun and am happy having a crazy, spontaneous night or a quiet night at home cuddling on the couch watching movies and playing video games. Speaking of cuddling, I am an extremely affectionate person by nature. I cannot possibly stress that enough. I am also an extremely kinky and sexually charged person, and while sex isn't the most important thing in a relationship, no long term relationship can survive without sexual compatibility. I tend to be on the dominant side and have never thought myself to be into anything too outrageous, but at least one girl I know nicknamed me Christian Grey, so take that how you will. Finally, since I'm looking for a gamer and/or nerd girl (the two aren't mutually inclusive, which is why I keep saying both) I should mention some of my more nerdish interests: video games, card and board games (Mostly Magic: the Gathering), cartoons, comic books, and probably just about anything else you can think of.

As for what I'm looking for, well there's not like a specific list of traits I'm looking for. I think it's foolish to make a list of all the qualities you're looking for in someone when every person is different and attraction is on a person by person basis, not to mention that some qualities I don't normally like but in the right combination can be very appealing, so I'd hate to pigeonhole myself on this one. Aside from looking for someone with similar interests, I'm open to any age (so long as it's legal), race, or body type. I'm interested in the whole package, and not just seeing how many items on a checklist you match. I will say that if I had a physical preference I tend to be more attracted to nonwhite girls, but if you're a white girl and everything I wrote sounded like some sort of crazy wet dream come true until that sentence, then don't be put off; like I said it's the whole person I'm interested in and a preference isn't a rule or requirement.

title: 1,557 words trying to find a connection.....
text:
Recently, I have been reading the w4m ads. I found very few of real interest, nothing that turned me on, but a lot of hyperbole about how I must be this or that checklist item; as if one were instructing the housekeeper to pick up something on the way home... 

So, being male, I then flitted into the casual encounters section. Did you realize that more women post there than in the W4M section? That section is fascinating; the things people want to do to/with total strangers! I was fascinated and, at times, disgusted by some of the depravity there. But for the most part, I was kind of sad. I started thinking about who was posting and why. Sure, hormones were involved, but beyond that--why? I realized that, although they said they wanted raw sex, most were souls seeking true intimacy; the connection with a kindred spirit. I looked at the whole spectrum of ads, and then just sat back and thought about why they'd shout into that emotional wilderness. 

I began imagining the personalities behind the ads. Where must they be in their lives, other than sitting in the dark, faces brightened by the glow of the screen? Looking beyond the haze of hormones, I began to feel underlying loneliness, and it's best friend - pain. I saw people enveloped in a cloud of hormones, and emotional emptiness. I saw suffering from no affection, intimacy, and no validation coming from the presence of love. Instead, they are living the agonizing loneliness of not having a partner, confidante, and lover. In many cases, I could see why they were alone, and why they couldn't connect; their addictions, barriers, and pain keep them from anything other than fleeting encounters doomed to failure. This keeps them from seeing, feeling, touching, and being touched by another soul. I left saddened, realizing that for some, personal barriers keep the beauty within unable to find connection for more than the duration of an orgasm. 

Over the years, I've come to feel that all intimate encounters are special. I consider intimacy those encounters wherein you see the core of the person, not just their guarded exterior. I consider an intimate encounter to be anything that allows that--and for many--we let our armor down when we find someone with whom we truly make love to. Yes, many are seeking intimacy, not just an orgasm. However, either they don't know how to find it, or they've painted themselves into a corner where they can't get it. They seek something that revives memory of vitality, love, emotion, and power emanating from true intimacy. I think that at most, they find a fleeting reminder. 

I don't want fleeting reminders; I want enduring presence. Intimacy is not something to be just brushed into the dustbin of worthlessness borne of meaningless sex with people with whom there is no connection. Intimacy isn't just sex, and it's not disposable - a gum wrapper gum that we just toss without a care. I think that it should be very intense and passionate, but how can it be if you aren't connected in some way? If an intimate encounter isn't special to you, then all you're doing is using another body to masturbate with. So many on here seem to think this is nothing but a sexual playground. Well, if you want that, then you'll find it--of course. I think this should be a venue to find a kindred spirit. 

Now don't get me wrong here, I'm not one of those who sits and wallows in the silly vapid inanity of thinking that sex is just sacred, a thing to be put up on a pedestal. Nope, it's an expression between those kindred spirits and it can be raw, hedonistic, aggressive, soft and sensual. We all can have sex in a way that'll make us orgasm, but really-is that all there is to sexuality and intimacy? 

I've looked into my soul, and decided that I want more from life than just fleeting encounters. I've come to the point in life where I feel there is nothing intimate about casual sex. Sex can be the most intimate adventure one can have and if you treat it as just casual, you diminish your own humanity. I don't want that, nor do you. I'd prefer to get to know you, see who you are in your core. Are you someone I can like, lust after and have a connection beyond the bedroom, in the realm of normal. We genuinely like one another and care about the well-being of the other person. This is antithetical to casual, is it not? 

Why would I like you? Well, here's some guides to help you on this track; you should be saying "yup that's a lot like me" when you're done reading. Not everything is needed, of course; but the general overview is. 

I'd think you're smart--not just a little; but a lot. Well-read and well-educated; you're able to think critically and not follow the herd--in fact, you despise the herd or find it mundane. In your heart of hearts, you're an altruist who loves babies, has a yearning to earn a PhD, and save the world; not one or the other---both. Curiosity is at the core of your being, you want to understand the world. In many areas, you're never satisfied; just like Prince's mother. However, there are far more areas that you're happy with than not. Most people find something about you to be sexy, or exotic; and I'm not the only one who wants you. Although it took a long time to understand this, you now know that soul mates do exist, but they are created over time; they are not instantaneous. You realized long ago that only when you learn to understand how the other person thinks can you connect to their soul, and therefore have true intimacy. 

What do I seek? Well, how about age? I'm open to a really mature 32-ish to about 48-ish. I am most attracted to taller women who have athletic, slim, or slender builds. I am not looking for an uber-princess who wants her meat cut for her---oh no---you are a problem solver. Generally speaking, you perform well under stress; you won't run away screaming (literally or metaphorically) in the middle of a crisis. 

You understand the academic field of Logic, and employ it as you do your emotions. I would bet you don't stifle your emotions, but you aren't ruled by them either. Trauma drama and pettiness is not something you engage in and won't tolerate either. You know how to agree, how to disagree and how to calm a situation instead of adding fuel to the fire. 

I'm 6'4" 216 lbs, Scandinavian. I'm quite symmetrical, body-wise. Long legs, and a chest larger my waist by quite a bit....I'm not perfect, be clear here. 

My looks? Well, I'm handsome to some, and not to others. I don't really think I'm anything astounding, but then others think I am. I get a fair amount of attention--but that's mostly due to my build, I think---and my intellect. 

To me, a woman becomes more physically attractive the more I like her and the more I get to know her---but I do have a silhouette I seek. That silhouette is thin, fit, athletic. I like swimmer's builds, or workout queens, or those who care for their bodies. I need those who treat their minds the same--because I'll take plain jane who is fit and brilliant over a ditzy model any day. 

I have a grad school education, and am quite analytical functional in technical fields. Being both right and left brained; I can build the house and (sorta) decorate it. I can build the gazebo where we'll eat our gourmet breakfast, and then can paint the scene on canvas that afternoon. I am ambidextrous, and it doesn't end there! 

In life, I have had truly amazing experiences and excessively horrible ones. I've met presidents and paupers; and prefer the paupers. I've met the richest man on earth, was once picked out of a crowd by the most famous man on earth, and have been in a private meeting with the most powerful man on earth - absolutely true stories! 

However, the truth is that I would prefer to work with the elderly in a nursing home who I can find out secrets to life from, or someone who is mentally handicapped; that's more fulfilling -- that's the true meaning of life. I've grown and learned, and you should be able to say the same. 

Photos are not important to me; your core is. If you fit the criteria above, we'll be friends, at the minimum. Send me that which tells me of your core--that which makes me want to meet you, and be with you over anyone else. Yes, I know that will take time---but, I've caught your attention---so it's your turn to catch mine. I seek connection.....and ability to do things in common. 

So.....who are you? I've given you 1,557 words here.....please return the favor to some degree. If you only want a photo, then don't bother. Perhaps you could start with telling me your stats, and why this resonated with you, and why.

Here's a few more words that apparently aren't obvious..... 

Be local. 

No penpals.

Not seeking FWB.

Absolutely NO SMOKERS. I'm really allergic, no matter how fantastic you are, it's bad for me.

title: Late 40s introvert looking for same
text:
Do you also read? A lot? Do you also long to share what the scenes and characters mean to you? Maybe dream about visiting a far off place together and experiencing your lover in a different setting? 

Does the physical connection happen after an emotional and spiritual connection? If so maybe you'll read on. If not best of luck in your search.

We both enjoy watching the sunset just because it's worthwhile. Is makeup as scarce in your home as sports memorabilia? Are you more comfortable in shorts and sandals? Do you also believe stockings and corporate man-suits de-feminizes women? Do you look at the gray in your hair and shrug, knowing somewhere there's a man who is interested in you; and not in how you look after you dye your hair and hide the wrinkles? Those things tell our stories, too. We should be own and not feel ashamed by them.

I don't care for obesity but find curves deliciously enticing, authentic and soft. Curves create comfy places for a lover. Places to lie our heads and grip when the need arises. 

We're both financially sound with a solid job and capable of travel. We also remember each stamp in our passport. Did the beauty of a favorite place keep part of your heart and imagination? If so perhaps you also yearn to travel again, maybe to replace that empty space with a new memory. Maybe you also want a lover who can spontaneously travel when a cheap flight is available? It would be fun to fly somewhere, just to hang out in the bookstores and coffeehouses and street cafes of a different city. We can scribble in our journals or read that new book. And after a light dinner we celebrate our love in a new place.

Bars and clubs are awful places to hang out. They are full of posers swiping left and right. Coffeehouses are more our speed. There we reflect on things and watch the current of humanity. 

Bookstores give us a sense of attachment to the enormity of humanity. Together we look into the range of experiences and places and times that make our lives feel small and insignificant. A bookstore is almost a holy place we can devote a Saturday evening to browsing.

We both have and know our self-worth but being an introvert means it's difficult to find someone. Being in our late 40s means we've seen most of it and are ready to settle into a lover and hit the second half of our lives beside someone else. We both know a lover doesn't make us complete--we're already complete. But a lover appreciates our nuances and can bring out joys and laughter and compassion not found in our friendships. A lover to live a life worth writing a novel about. Even if we're the only two who read it.

Like me you're also a little bit of hippy. Your long natural hair gets tangled in the stubble on my face. And when we go to bed I smell it and it's a part of you that's a part of me, even when we're asleep. We're both comfortable with our bodies knowing the imperfections are one of the things that we find comfort in--the little unique things about us. 

Do you also look for a sharp intellect in others? If someone can't tell you the last book they read does an alarm go off? Did you also just finish one and are on to the next? When people project their insecurities with clear-cut and grand statements about (fill in the blank) do you flee? Then you're probably also comfortable with the gray in the world. Because we both know it's our choices that make us who we are and we need the gray to choose.

Does television also distract you from things more important, like silence and music? The scratch of your pencil in your journal? The joy of feeling a lover's heartbeat and their breath on your neck? Even the often distracting but sometimes soothing hum of the refrigerator is better than the mass 'entertainment' on television. We're both past that.

I have little to prove except I'm loyal and attentive to the woman I love. Sports is for men afraid of playing with the fire of things that matter: fidelity and honesty and the depth of feeling and vulnerability love brings. Like you I avoid men who hide their inability to be vulnerable beneath the veneer of swaggering egos. I know the real men that make a difference are those who have written novels and strummed guitars and taught the world to tread lightly. Just as you know the women who have made a difference in the world are those who rose above sexist norms and challenged social norms with courage, truth and conviction. Courage is the ability to be vulnerable, like posting a personal ad on Craigslist. Or responding to one.

We are both drug and disease free and that's so important we prove it to each other. If a relationship deepens enough for us to get naked and make love, sharing the results of an STD test is expected and respected. But we're not in a rush for that. We appreciate the importance of getting to know someone first. When we make love that's what it will be.

No picture required. Looks are important but youth and genetics were fun when we were in our 20s and based feelings on them. If we decide to meet face-to-face I think it would be fun to describe ourselves to each other and then meet somewhere public. I like mystery and one of the greatest mysteries we can know are our feelings for another person. And if chemistry happens that's great. If not we'll probably be better for having at least met and talked.

If you reply: Please put one of your favorite books in the subject. 

And if you've made it this far you already know this. I'm putting this here for people who skim when they read: like me you're in your late 40s, single, not interested in friends-with-benefits or no-strings-attached sex, and can prove you are disease free. You're financially stable with a good job and can travel. You know what INTJ means and can tell me where you scored ;-)

title: Confident(ially) dominant
text:

And, sure, I probably have a larger pool of potential partners than if I were a submissive woman. But I'm looking for a meaningful relationship. 

My dominance is a significant part of my sexuality, but it does not define me as a person; I have a fulfilling vanilla life that I want to share with a sexually adventurous woman who also does not let her sexual orientation characterize her entire life. So here's the fundamental problem: I'm attracted to that rare breed of smart, ambitious -- even slightly arrogant -- women who relish being in submission, or sexually submissive. 

It's my Achilles' heel, this attraction to bright and driven women. This attraction has nothing to do with her career or financial success, but rather her personality type. These women keep me interested. They're engaging, intelligent, charming, polite. They have (and can run) their own lives, can offer opinions, have areas of expertise and provide intelligent dinner conversation. In short, they have a lot to add to a relationship. title: Seeking 420 girl for live in situation
text:
I'm looking for a girl who's single somewhere in her early twenties to early thirties to live with me and help with the garden this year, growing food and 420.. 
March-November I need help;
preparing soil
Starting plants
Transplanting
Watering
Feeding
Pruning
Harvesting
Etc...
This is s great opportunity for someone who loves plants, doesn't mind working outside or getting your hands dirty.
Everything will be grown organically. So if you're an organic fanatic like me or you wanna learn how to grow organically you'll love it.
This property is located between Florence and Wetmore at the base of the wet mountains, mostly in the woods with a few open areas. Lots of wildlife around. Unfortunately you cannot bring your pets here. Unless it's something small in a cage or aquarium. No dogs no cats, it sucks but that's just the way it is..
It's pretty isolated and the dirt road to get here is rough and rocky in some spots. 
So if you have a truck that's great, cars can make it most of the time unless we get a lot of rain or snow so keep that in mind... 
No kids, No dogs, No cats 

The house is a 3bed/ 2 bath You'll have your own bedroom and bathroom and rent will be free however you will be expected to do most of the cleaning around the house which isn't a whole lot since it's just me here and I do a pretty good job cleaning up after myself. One thing I should mention is visitors/ friends cannot come over, you'll have to meet them somewhere or go to their place... The less people who come here the better. 
This arrangement can be worth your time in so many ways. I can't really pay you much for the first few months but towards late September/October and November your hard work will really pay off... 
I understand this isn't for everybody, the whole no friends over and no dogs/cats can be deal breakers for a lot. But I know there's someone out there who will fit in perfect.

If this piques your interest contact me with any questions or concerns you have. 
I'm an Mmj patient and prefer that you are too but if you aren't we can get you your card. 
If you're wondering I'm a single man in my early thirties.

title: Are You MARRIED and thinking about placing an ad BUT...
text:
You don't want to deal with the hundreds of replies that women often receive. Most are from perverts, weirdos, druggies, crazies, con artists and who knows what. Finding a needle in a haystack is a cinch compared to finding the guy that is safe, sane, fun, and discrete who knows what you really want and need. Let me try to save you some of that hassle and risk... 

I am guessing you have been married or in a relationship for a long time. The romance has evaporated. Passion - what's that? Hell, even the sex is routine if it exists at all. You are more like business partners or roommates. But there are so many responsibilities and obligations... 

You long to feel noticed, appreciated and respected for all you do. You need to feel wanted and desired for the intelligent, sexy, sensuous woman you know you still are. A bar pick up or one night stand isn't you. Sure you miss the kissing that makes your toes curl and the great sex but it isn't just that. You miss the deep connection, the comfort, the affection, the sharing, the feeling of being excited and of being able to arouse a special someone that you want to please. You want to relax and laugh and be happy and free at least for a private moment. You would love to feel warm and anxious with anticipation of our next message, call or meeting. You want to be a woman who is alive. 

I understand and share these feelings and longings. I, too, find myself in 'that' kind of marriage. I am also not willing to risk everything on a cheap fling but rather seek a very special, intelligent, mature woman who has considered an adult friendship and a lover. I am Caucasian, active and in good shape.

title: Looking for another intelligent person
text:
So, I am simply incompatible with dating sites, to start. Match.com? Give me a break. Does every single person on that site appear in one of their commercials? Is that place not truly a repository of headshots attached to vapid personalities? And then OKCupid was supposed to be where all the fellow geeks convene, but it turns out it is also the choice hangout for women who all coincidentally have a father in the hospital whose uncertain fate is always mysteriously most dire every time you are about to actually meet.

Losing faith, I resort to desperate measures for affection, like that BP site. Just know that if you are of African descent, you have not a snowball's chance at a frickin' KKK cross barbecue up there, what with the appalling wall of "NO BLACK MEN" one encounters. You'd really think you've entered a timewarp to the 1920s looking at crap like that.

I've even tried more "legitimate" companionship services like Denver Ladies, which has interesting individuals, but doling out hundreds of dollars for a few hours of companionship is depressing to even think about.

So, who am I looking for? Someone who likes to learn, enjoys watching interesting videos and reading interesting literature, and even talking about it from time to time. Someone who like video games, especially of the RPG variety. Someone who actually plays such things, by the way, and would consider any of the above activities actual enjoyable things, rather than something pleasant to mention in a profile.

I only say this because I am still shocked when I try to meet someone who says they like books but cannot talk about what they are reading, or they are intimidated by the amount of text in this profile so far. Make no mistake: if this is too much text, we will not sync up.

I should stress that I am NOT simply looking for someone to read books with, or play games with, or simply a friend. And indeed, it would be rather inappropriate to initiate a friendship with someone who is specifically looking for a sexual relationship. I already have friends and if I were looking for more, then I would say so. This is "Men seeking Women" Craigslist personals, and so if what I describe does not seem fitting for a sexual relationship, then I am wrong for you. Seriously, there are many other sites out there for finding book clubs and friends. If I were looking for just that, why the heck would I be posting here? I cannot be more explicit that I am looking for something more.

Also, I do not have kids and would prefer to meet someone who does not as well.

If you've made it this far, great! Someone who does not like clubbing or bars, and prefers hanging out at a quiet place, like a living room or café. Someone who likes porn and is into sex. In short, someone who actually values the life of the mind and enjoys watching movies and documentaries.

title: I am looking for mutual alchemy and my cheerleader....
text:
I'm looking for mutual alchemy and to be each other's mutual cheerleader but I think it's has to be mutual not one way.... 

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.
4) An attitude of mutual reconciliation and a desire to makes things work

I'm looking for someone:

* who supports my career vision and allows me to support theirs
* with whom I can grow with and change together
* who shares my values (family, moral, others)
* who reminds me that I am not my accomplishments nor my degree(s), not my paycheck, not my job title, and especially not for my inheritance (I don't have one btw)
* who loves me for who I am 
* who remembers that it's important that we love one another not because of what we have done but because of who we are
* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together
* with whom I can adventure through life with as we grow and change, and with whom I can create something beautiful, extraordinary, and sometimes hard to explain
* who has no or minimal emotional baggage
* who understands that honest and constant communication is key to a successful, strong relationship

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same. No age, race, or other barriers though I'd prefer if you are in the 18-33 age range.

I recently moved to Los Angeles from the east coast but I'm in the Denver area frequently for work. I'm willing to move there or anywhere for the right person so please don't let the distance be a deterrent to exploring if we might be right for each other.

I look forward to hearing from you.

title: I don't want to be 35 and single
text:
Hello, thanks for checking this out. I'm going to give you some full disclosure before you get started on this mini book you're about to read. I'm going to say a few things that I feel needed said, and we will just go from there. I don't meant his as a rant, I just want to be upfront about things. sooo... let's get to it? lol

First, I'm out of a break up. About a month and half ago. It's still new ish, but I'm just not wanting to sit around thinking about it anymore. I am moving on and this is a step in that direction. Sometimes, people just grow apart. It happens. I'm not bitter or anything about it. I actually feel better and I think it was probably always going that direction. We met through CL and as weird as that can seem, it worked really well for 2 and half years. 



I'm 29, I have no kids, never married. My family is in Indiana, I grew up there, and I live out here and do not want to move back. I was in the Air Force for 8 years as Military Police, it was fun and I don't regret it. I've finished 1 year of college, I have the ability to go back but haven't yet decided what I am going to go back for. I'm leaning towards some sort of engineering degree. I have an alright job, I make enough money to pay my bills, spend money on things I want, and continue to save money. I don't know what I'm going to do for president, since is a relevant situation right now, but I'm leaning towards any non-career politician choice. 

So.. the good. 

I'm a nice down to earth guy. I have a good personality. I don't get so upset about things that I can't function, I don't yell or scream in an argument, I know how to make compromises, I'm intelligent, I know how to have fun and have a tendency to know what people need. I am very good listener and know to express my emotions in a healthy way. I'm going to be a great husband and wonderful father one day. I am lots of fun and can be completely silly about things. I'll be a fool to the extreme just to make you laugh until you cry. And I'll do it happily.

I take care of things that need to be taken care of. I don't have a lot of drama in my life and I'm financially secure with where I'm at. I love to and am a great cook. If you give me a choice I'm probably going to choose go out than stay in, but I do like cuddling on a couch holding hands. I like to be there for the person I'm with. If you have a hard day, I'm here for you. If every day is a hard day, you need to get your life together. 


The bad,
I'm currently pretty set in my ways. I'm not going to change a whole lot I don't think. I am who I am at this point. I squeeze the toothpaste from the end, and if it's wrinkled in the middle it irritates me. I hate not chewing with your mouth shut. If you tell me something stupid like, 'I don't eat meat because it's cruel' or 'I'm voting for Bernie Sanders or Hillary Clinton' or 'We should eliminate the death penalty' or any other obviously stupid things like that, I'm going to tell you that you're wrong. And stupid. And then if you ask I'll tell you why you're wrong and stupid. I can be pretty flexible on ideas, but I'm pretty stubborn when I'm right and I know I'm right.


About me,
I like hot wings and beer, I own guns, I don't take shit from people (if someone leaves their shopping cart in the middle of the parking lot, I'm the asshole that tells them they need to go put it where it belongs...and if they want to argue I'll argue and make them feel bad), I like sports- football the most- , automobiles, I'll blair Taylor Swift and cry watching 'Too Cute' on netflix or youtube. I'm not a big let's go hike a 14er for time guy, but if you just want to go for a walk on a trail or just be outside I'm there for you. Mostly if you have an idea I'm generally down for it as long as we don't go to jail time, or the hospital. And I don't smoke or do drugs.. any drugs. Not even pot you hippies, it is a drug.

I'm pretty flexible with things and I'm a guy that can get along with anyone. If you want black tie I can do that, if you want sweat pants around a campfire I can do that too. I need you to be on that level also. Which brings us to you....

What I'm looking for. 

Someone who is happy with life. You don't have to be happy with your life, but you need to be happy with life in general. If you're miserable everyday you wake up, go get yourself together and then come back here. Just be a good person and with it. Be mostly drama free and have a good view on things. NO smoking, no exceptions. Have a job that pays your bills. Have time and want a relationship. 

Look good, be in decent shape. I don't need a toothpick, but you need to be healthy. I'm not a rail, but I'm not 300lbs either. No kids. And for the sake of just saying it, be around my age.. if you're 40 I'm sorry. If you're 18, hey I'm not a perfect angel and still a guy, I'll take you on a date but we're not getting married. I'm not putting my picture on here. I'll give you one if you e-mail me. I'm decent looking, not brad pitt. More of Chris Pratt featured kind of guy minus his new found ridiculous six pack. Imagine him about half way between his chubby phase, and his cut up phase, and that's about where I'm at. And probably will stay. Just an average dude. But I do have a good smile and eyes that are beautiful. Just saying.. lol I know what I got and I'm not ashamed of it. 


Look, really I just want to see where things go. This isn't 'hey we are going to get married'. It's more of 'Hey you seem like a fun person I'd get along with and I like they way you look, lets go grab a beer and a burger or whatever your choice of finger food is and just have a fun night getting to know each other. If you don't like me and I don't like you, then it was nice to meet you and good luck. If we like each other, we can do this a few more times and then go on a 'date, date'. 

If any of this sounds like something you are looking for, just say hi and we can go from there. It's no pressure. It can be tough to do that sometimes so tell me something about you. 

Are you a coke or pepsi person, star wars or star trek, sunrise or sunset, favorite 3 non sex things to do or just whatever comes to mind. Just say hello. 



Thanks for spending some time on this, I look forward to hearing from you. 
Drew

I realized this guy has no idea the world is in fact going on around him. I would like to sneak into his house at night and punch him in the face as he sleeps. So about me, I use like to use 4 words for the most part. Dude, whatever, fuck and retarded. Granted, I have not used them much here, but whatever. I snore loud as fuck. I think fanny packs are retarded as are crocks. I am a master is ass slapping hair pulling and kissing. I have a full time job and a car and my own place. I am pretty tech savy, so I am often times asked to fix computers, cable, hook up xboxs and fix iphones. Once, probably 5 years ago, I had an offer to hook up a cable box in return from a bj. I love to watch people, the stupid fucking things they do when they think others aren't watching. I hate the cold, I hate the snow. I love football. title: Blue Steel? LeTigre? Ferrari? They're all the same!
text:
Well, I thought I'd take a shot at this. Maybe there are more lurkers on CL than posters - I sure hope so, because there isn't much encouragement to be found in what's posted. Actually, I had a look at some of the "men seeking women" posts and, I have to say, if you're a woman reading these ads either a) you're very brave, b) you are endlessly optimistic in the face of adversity, or c) you have a morbid sense of humor. Whatever the case, I salute you. 

I find lists of requirements tedious and tacky. Sure, we all have our fantasy wish list, but I suspect many, if not most, people in relationships are surprised at how little their partners resemble theirs - and certainly wouldn't be able to tell if someone would be a good match from a few sentences on a website. Let's embrace serendipity. 

I'm 44 and fit. 5'9. And I appreciate those of you who like tall guys but when you specify that a guy be 6'+ that strikes me as equivalent to me specifying a girl with a D-cup. Just sayin'. Although I'm actually more of a leg man... 

My career is in financial services, but I define myself more by my hobbies: motorcycles, golf, fitness, movies, reading, etc. I like to go out occasionally, but I'm generally pretty low-key and happier hanging out one-on-one or in a small group. 

It would be helpful, and appropriate, if you send a picture along with your reply. It's 2016. EVERYBODY has a flattering photo or two. 

I hope there are some brave optimists with a great sense of humor out there.

title: Hours are like diamonds, don't let em waste
text:
If you can name the song from which those lyrics come and the group that recorded it, you've just gained countless Brownie points. Hello, my name is Patrick and I am a partially disabled Veteran (USAF) who is seeking a companion for compelling conversation, home cooked dinners, movies on TV, sports watching (live and on TV), the Arts and almost anything else. I am NOT looking for hook-ups or one-night stands. Friends first, then benefits. . .? A REAL relationship is what I seek, so please no links to other websites to see/meet you. I am an honest man with honest values. I don't like liars or dishonest people. I also don't like "material girls" who judge you on your zip code or what type of vehicle you have.

I am not rich. I live on a fixed income, and do okay considering what I get. If you're looking for a sugar daddy, keep looking. I live alone in a 1BR apartment with no roommates and no pets (been thinking of getting some fish). I have no kids of my own. I have spiritual values and attend church regularly. I drink socially and am 420 friendly, nothing else. Please be the same or at least tolerant. NO DRUGGIES PLEASE. I love to cook and am pretty good at it. I make my own salsas and green chili and even make my own chicken and beef stocks for cooking.

For fun I enjoy crossword puzzles, garage sales/thrift store shopping, a good book, listening to music (mostly classic rock), ice cream, a day or night in Black Hawk, Rockies games on a sunny Sunday afternoon, tailgating at Broncos games, an impromptu picnic, a good margarita, volunteering and so much more. I don't live a boring life. As I said, I live alone, and love living alone except that at times I get lonely. I'm looking for someone who is experiencing the same thing. I don't ask for much, just respect and respectability.

Attraction is important. I eat healthy, with the occasionally vice (like cheese cake and chocolate) and am fit and in good shape for a man my age, so no BBWs or Eat-a-holics. I prefer white, Hispanic or Middle Eastern women; I'm not into inter-racial dating, sorry. Age is really not important, but would prefer someone in my age group +/- 10-15 years.

Please respond with a picture; I put mine out there so you know what I look like. I'd like to see who it is that I am responding to. No pic, no response. If you've read this far, you're miles ahead of the game. I'm not looking for "arm candy" or someone to show-off to my friends. I'm looking for a friend who will bring out the best in me and me in them. Thank you for reading, and I hope to hear from you soon. Until then. . .

Peace and happiness, Patrick

BTW I am a Raiders fan, if you couldn't tell.

title: Looking for a wonderful woman for a LTR
text:
I would really like to meet a fun outgoing female who has goals for herself and is making something of herself in life. I am open to talking to anyone, regardless of their situation, but the main thing is that you are ambitious, know what you want to do to improve yourself, and that you want to reach whatever goals that you may set for yourself. I like to see people succeed and to be happy in life no matter what it is that they are doing :) Even though I am interested in a person that is going to school or already has an education, I am not ruling out those that don't have an education and that have other goals for themselves. I am totally cool with the idea of you just being a stay at home mother and taking care of your man and family or that you are in a difficult time in your life and need a change for the better. Whatever your situation may be, I am open to it as long as you mean well for yourself and others.

I would like you to be looking for something serious. We can start out as casual until we know things can progress properly. I would love to start a family at some point and it would be great if you have the desire to start a family too. It is my preference that you have no children. 

This is the main thing I want to put out there about my situation. I travel a lot for work and I am only back in the state so often for short vacations at a time. The ideal situation that I would prefer is to be able to find someone willing to travel with me on the road, whether it be permanently or temporarily, given your situation. I am willing to be with someone that can deal with me being on the road but there has to be trust and honesty if that situation is to work. At that point, it would be a long distance relationship and a lot of people can't deal with that. That is part of the reason why I haven't been able to have a steady relationship in a long time. I haven't found someone willing to travel with me or that can deal with me being gone for periods of time. I have plans to eventually get a place of my own but until that happens, I would love to have my partner travel with me and start a family while out on the road.

Now, for some of the other finer details. I am looking for a sexy beautiful Latina. That is my preference but I love all races and I am open to all that find this ad intriguing. I would like you to be healthy, clean, active, and one who takes care of themselves all around. I am active and like to be on the move so it would be nice to have someone that can do the same. I would like you to be average, athletic, or fit.

When it comes to sexuality, I would really like a lady that is kinky. The more kinky the better. I love sex and love to be adventurous so I would love to have a partner that is the same. I'm not saying that you have to do everything but having an open mind would be a great asset as well as having the willingness to explore while enjoying the moment for what it is. Overall, it's about mutual satisfaction of physical activities while having fun and a good time.

A little about me. I am a stable man. Mentally, emotionally, and financially. I take care of myself and those that are close to me. I am respectful, outgoing, well versed, and open minded to everything in life. I respect people's boundaries and don't impose anything upon someone that isn't willing to accept it. I love life and I love enjoying life and if I can allow someone else to do the same, then I'm all for it :)

I am a rocker type guy. I have spiked hair, mustache, and a goatee. I know it's not for everyone but that is how it is for right now. Nothing says I can't change it given the correct circumstance and I do tend to change my look from time to time depending on what kind of mood I'm in. I have nice clothes too and I can dress proper when needed. Other than that, I am a jeans and band t-shirt kind of guy. I don't have any tattoos but I do have several piercings though nothing crazy.

I know it may seem like I am asking for a lot but it really isn't. I just want to find my other half that is willing to start a family with a loving guy while being on the road instead of in a solitary place. I know she is out there :)

If you are interested, please don't hesitate to tell me about yourself and ask any questions that you may have.

Age preference is 18-30. Please be serious about traveling with me and starting a family.

Please put "Travel" in the subject line so I know that you are real and that you read and understood my ad.

title: Are you the one I'm describing?
text:
I remember the first time I saw you. You're the type of women whose beauty doesn't impose itself. While everyone around you is desperately trying look a certain way and stand out by following trends you just trust your femininity. That day you taught me something important about myself. You taught me that as much as I might seek out beauty, what I really am after is what beauty evokes in me. 

You're smart and not just book smart. You have plenty of common sense and you're always eager to learn something new. You pride yourself on being an independent thinker and don't just accept an opinion because someone famous said it real loud. This confidence in your knowledge allows you to go about sharing what you know with others in a way that it inspires and enables them without making them feel irrelevant or foolish for asking.

Of course being intelligent doesn't mean you aren't intuitive. I'm not sure if I've ever known a person who feels as deeply as you do. When you're happy you're happy. If you're sad you're sad. When you're angry it isn't hidden. In the past I think guys have shied away from you because of your willingness to experience the full range and intensity of your emotions. They thought you were a hassle. But we know better. Your willingness to feel your emotions is an opportunity for growth. 

We both understand that if you put on a happy face and suppressed what you were feeling that wouldn't make you a perfect women; it would make you a phony one. The truth is that you prefer a certain amount of change and variety and become dissatisfied when you feel like you aren't becoming a better version of yourself. You know despite what others may say, you can always feel more and I'm glad to have that type of person in my life.

You and I laugh a lot. Thinking about it now I imagine it probably annoys people. Oh well, they'll get over it. When I'm with you everything else seems to fall away. You keep me very present. Whatever may have been on my mind is overwhelmed with what I'm experiencing with you right here and now. Even the most mundane things like taking a walk or making dinner have a level of intimacy to them that I can't say I've felt with anyone else. It's nice that at the end of the day you and I can simply be present with each other and not let any nonsense from the rest of the world bother us.

I admire how driven you are. I can't help but be proud when I watch you go after your goals. We're both similar that way although in watching you I've picked up on something a little more. When you go after something there are these moments where you seem to be overtaken by something greater then yourself. Whether you want to call it destiny or fate or something else you seem to genuinely let go and be taken in directions that you wouldn't be able to reach otherwise. Seeing that kind of stuff pushes me. 

One thing is for sure. Nobody can deny that you're fun. No matter how stressed out I get, you're right there encouraging me because you believe in me. Because of all of this, I wake every morning wanting and working to be an even better man than I am already.

title: Looking for a long term FWB
text:
Hi there! So if you're one of those people just browsing through the creep-tastic posts here for a laugh, I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to disappoint you-- I'm actually a moderately normal person. I know, I know. It's crazy, but normal people do occasionally post to Craigslist. Though it's kind of like the myth of the honest politician. They all claim to be, but only a tiny fraction of them truly are. It's up to you to figure out who to trust, who to be suspicious of, and who to impeach for lying about a blowjob in the oval office. Though I suppose that last one is only mildly relevant.

So why is a normal person posting here? Well thanks for asking, anonymous peruser of casual sex personals! Honestly, it's because I'm a very quiet person. I'm not shy, I don't lack confidence, I'm not uncomfortable around people, but I just tend to keep most things to myself, which makes it rather difficult to meet people. In addition to that, I'm also very perceptive, very empathic, good at reading people's thoughts and emotions, sensitive and communicate much better physically than I do verbally, whether it's with a touch on the arm, a kiss on the neck, or a hand around the hips.

I only started having sex pretty late (comparatively) in life-- Just a couple years ago. And it turns out those qualities I just listed seem to make me fairly decent at it. However, I tend to be pretty single-minded about things I like. I don't settle for being good at something, or even great at something. If I enjoy it, I want to be the best at it. I've learned a lot about intimacy and physical fulfillment in these last two years, and want to keep learning more. Unfortunately that whole quiet thing I mentioned makes it rather challenging to meet new friends. Hence, back to why I'm posting on Craigslist.

One thing I've discovered is that the better you know someone, the better the sex tends to get, so ultimately I would be looking for a real friends-with-benefits thing. But of course there's really no way to know if you're going to click with someone physically until you start exchanging fluids, so if it doesn't work out, no big deal-- Promise I'm no stalker. (Back to that whole trust thing...)

As for the mundane stats and such... I'm 29 years old, 5'11", lean, athletic build. I put effort in to my appearance, I hope you do too. Just ask for a picture and I'll be more than happy to send one.

As far as age goes-- It's not really a thing to me. You could be 18 or you could be 48 as long as we've got a real connection. So if you're in a similar situation as me, or if you can just sympathize with what I'm saying, get in touch. We can exchange a few emails, maybe some texts, meet for coffee, and take things from there. I'm not in any rush to jump right into bed with a stranger, I suspect you're not either. ;) Please put the name of your favorite season in the subject line, so I know you're real. Be awesome!

title: MY INCARCERATED NIGHTMARE
text:
Everyone has a right to pursue happiness, it's written in our declaration of independence. Where to start, where to begin. If only this ad could start out with, "I'm your knight in shining armor, here to save the damsel in distress and sweep you off your feet to take you to my castle." If only I could lie to you and sell you that kind of dream. I wish I could, but one - I'm not a liar. And before you get to my castle in my dream I have to sell, you will have to go on a perilous journey - one of patience, endless letters and dealing with a real romantic. Man, I hate drama. 

And of course, if you have read this whole, then your perilous journey has already started. Blah, blah let's get to the point - I'm incarcerated, yep in T.D.C. That's Texas Department of Corrections for those of you who don't know. I'm not prison material. I'm just as innocent of my crime as Alexander Dumas' Count of Monte Cristo. But I assure you, I don't have the heart or the upbringing of a criminal. Shit happens, just as I couldn't control this storm or never wanted to. I love Texas, but screw the legal system. 

I'm 36, and I'll be out in two years. I'm looking for a best friend, a lover, a marriage, a family. I don't mind if you have kids, I have three. I want more, but it's not a must or a deal-breaker. I'm 6ft. tall, olive skin, 205 lbs. I like to read, write, explore, camping, outdoors, art, museums, movies, animals, fishing, vikings, life, rain, water. I'm a scorpio, plus I like to travel and hard work. I'm here because of something I didn't do, because I'm a romantic and listened to a toxic person who whispered artificial words of love in my ear, and fell at her feet in mercy because of her twisted ideals. This was the kind of hurt that could only be inflicted by someone you loved, who you thought loved you. It was sort of like being stabbed from the inside out. 
But in life, I have come to learn every flight begins with a fall. I would like for you to be open minded, but not in an adulterous way. Life is too short to be unhappy. I don't put up with the likes of liars and the sort. I would prefer for you to be honest and have a good heart, and I will do the same for you. I'm a firm believer in do unto others as you would have them do unto you. I would like to lead a natural kind of life, going off the grid but still connected. Be willing to travel by my side, be willing to camp, watch movies either at home or in a theater, be willing to listen to me rant and rave about books and media and my stupid opinions and poetry. To encourage me and my ideas to be a better person, and encourage me to do good things, to watch the rain with me, hike into the wild together, and listen to music and slow dance together. I will do the same for you.
"This is not the end. It's not even the beginning of the end. But it is perhaps, the end of the beginning." 
"Hic Dracones Sunt"

To contact this person, please send a picture(s) along with a handwritten or typed letter to:
Charles D. Barbee # two-zero-one-three-four-two-three
Huntsville Unit, 815 12th St.
Huntsville, TX, 77340

(Please write the above inmate number numerically)

Pictures get a rapid response. No games or lies please. FEMALES ONLY.

title: Take a look, and see what you think.
text:
Now then, where to start.. I guess I'll start with a little about myself. Physically, I am a Caucasian male, with a lithe physcial build, brunette hair, green eyes - and as I've been told, very "kissable" lips. I consider my sense of style, or absolute lack thereof, as pretty typical for a guy my age. Not to say that I look like a train-wreck, mind you.. I prefer the label "hot mess". :P

In regards to my personality, I'm a pretty relaxed - and lighthearted guy. A bit nerdy, being a bookworm and all that. I admittedly have a darker, more sarcastic sense of humor; but as of yet, I haven't met a person that I didn't get along well with. I tend to consider my more outstanding traits to be my absolute belief in loyalty before all else - the continued survival of chivalry - and being genuine, no matter what may come of it. I have a small group of friends I'm very close to, and my family means a lot to me. I'm not afraid of my emotions by any means, and I'm definitely not the shy type. I'm what you'd call a social drinker; I've never smoked, and I've never been married - nor had any children. I like to spend my time listening to drum and bass music, playing video games (in moderation), painting, reading (I always have my face in a book), and going out with my close-nit group of pals.

What I'm looking for isn't your typical relationship, admittedly, but I think it's something that others can easily identify with. I crave physical affection, and emotional intimacy, as much as the average male longs for sex - possibly more so. Now, that's not to say I don't have a very healthy sexual appetite - because I certainly do. But what I want is to have it to take a backseat early on. I want to take my time to get to know you. I want to cuddle together and watch movies; play board-games in bad weather; talk for hours each night - but also be able to enjoy a comfortable silence with you. I want to just savor the healthy aspects of a relationship, without all of the drama and needless pressure on "where this relationship is going". Now, that isn't to say that I'm not looking for something lasting, because I certainly am. I'm not the least bit afraid of commitment. I'm hoping that said relationship would become something more, but I also don't want to rush things.

Now, what I'm searching for in a girl, is the very things I pride myself most on. Loyalty, a big heart, and a moral compass that isn't compromised when things get tough. I want someone who is genuine - someone who's real, flaws and all. Physically, I've never considered myself shallow, so I don't have a set "type", but that's not to say that I'm not somewhat picky. I mean, admittedly, I do prefer Caucasian females; and I'm also a sucker for large, lovely eyes. But that's about it really in the way of preferences.

I know what you're thinking. Sounds too good to be true, right? Why is he single? Well, I recently broke out of a very long relationship - and am only now in a position where I want to begin "dating" again. Only, lets face it, typical dating sucks. So I figured, maybe, just maybe, there was a girl in a situation like myself.. looking for something more.. something different. Now, to be perfectly clear - if I haven't been enough - this isn't a "friend with benefits deal", or the like. There seems to be some confusion about that when I posted last time, so I figured I'd try and clear that up right away. I am looking for a long term relationship. :)

I will send several pictures of myself to those interested; I'm just a bit wary of pic collectors on Craigslist. Oh, and please put your favorite color as the header of your email, and a facial - so that I know you're real, and not illiterate. I will not respond to emails that ignore this part, as I'll just assume you didn't care enough to read the ad, or you're a bot. Both are equally bad.

So, if you're still here with me, and I sound like someone you'd like to get to know, shoot me a message. I look forward to talking with you soon. 

(I'm very real, the weather was windy and cloudy today.)
