title: Still havent found what im looking for
text:
to the girl i'm seeking: 

i wanna have breakfast with you. waffles with syrup and scrambled eggs and OJ at a local cafe. or on the road. or in my kitchen where we mess around and laugh and then jump on the bed to watch a movie. i want to kiss u while u tell me about some favorite movie of yours. i wanna order the movie if i don't have it and get all excited when it arrives in the mail. i wanna feel ur cute little feet under the sheet in the morning as they look for me because they're cold, and i tickle u for half a second...ur cute little squeals and then i wrap my arms around u until you're warm. 

i wanna laugh with u. take the dog for walks. talk about nothing. talk about everything. talk philosophy. watch Andy SNL shorts. find something strange or beautiful together every time we're together: an object on the sidewalk, a mind-tripping thought, a sunset, the sound of your voice. 

i want to hold your hand for the first time and feel my heart catch on fire, or butterflies when my hand cups the small of you back for the first time and kiss u deeply. i wanna dive-bomb ur cheek with little surprise-attack kisses when ur not looking. i wanna lean in...breath softly and put my lips gently on your neck for the first time.. 

i wanna get drunk with you, and on you. 

i want you to let me plan a trip and just go with it. on a boat, on a plane, in a car, in the rain. i want to get seats next to each other on a plane and be the annoying couple that won't stop playing...and sometimes want to be the mature couple who finds all kinds of deep meaning in silence or conversations. i want to help you get up on a surfboard behind the boat for the first time on a lake, or give u a yell of encouragement when you get up on the wakeboard. i wanna take you rock climbing and tell you how it doesn't matter how good you are...it's just an experience. i wanna hold you from behind on a trip to catalina and get drunk on the smell of your neck and the ocean air. 

i want you to be there when my friends and i are playing games in the pool. i wanna cry 'marco' and try to find your 'polo' in the crowd. haha. i want to push you in the pool and have you pull me in with you. i want to KISS you in the pool...your hair wet, the sound of your laughter, my strength against your softness. i wanna watch tv in the jacuzzi with u, but ignore what's on. 

i want the slowwwwest sex. the kind that takes hours. a candle, air conditioning and the kind of patience that hurts. so. good. i want to taste your kisses...explore the warmth of your neck with my lips...exchange kiss for kiss from top to bottom....and i want that hard sex that can't wait. bathroom counter sex, car sex, trail of clothes throw you on the bed i want you NOW sex. 

i want to hold you. i want to hold you by the beach, in public on a bench, when you're sad or scared, and when you're laughing...or crying. especially if you're crying. 

i want those knowing glances across the room in public. i want to meet a bunch of characters with you and laugh at life's variety. 

i wanna dress up and hit a nice restaurant we've never been to, and some we have. i wanna drive through taco bell. 

i wanna be cool with you. to experience intense passions and curiosities...but also be able to just....chill. to be. 

i want those speechless moments. i wanna KNOW how short life is. i want u to remind me when i forget. i want to remind u. this moment is all we have. 

i want u to feel safe with me. 

i want to know u have my back, and i know that i have urs. i wanna you to be one of those few people i can be around and completely let my guard down sometimes...to be belly-up vulnerable with you, because i trust u. 

i want u to trust me, when i make moves to care for you. 

i wanna share back rubs, hugs and cuddles, and i want us to be cool with space when we need to breath. we're just so cool. we're not jealous. we're not paranoid. but if someone cracks now and then, it's okay and they get hugs and kisses for it. but then it's back to cool. 

i want us to be strong enough in love to feel free being completely sappy and touchy feely in public...but i want it to rest on a foundation of monster strength. our love is anything but silly. anything but spineless. 

i want those silly moments. i want those rainy days and those days when ur sick and i cancel everything i can to care for u. i want to sip on capri sun juicy drinks like we're five and walk through a long-forgotten ghost town, or along a white sands beach...or a star hike away from the city lights where we can see the milky way and feel how small we are...and how hugely lucky we are 

i want you to be as real as the rising sun, and meaningful as that achingly beautiful memory that haunts your dreams 

And now that you've read my ad, I want you to REPLY!!! Wink put "life's a Beach" in subject, I have ran this ad before and please only reply if you are looking for something LTR, no endless emails or anything of the such. And as you ladies put on here "no pic no reply"

text:
It's interesting to me how many times I have heard..."You're just too good for me" or "You're a really good guy, someone will be happy to have you someday" or "You're a really good friend" or "You're really sweet." Do you like to be treated like shit? Do you like being abandoned? Why do Women keep going back to their ex's who treat like them garbage? I just don't understand how you could possibly go back to someone who didn't appreciated you in any way.

We only say other shit to spare your feelings. But think of it this way: If a sweet but unattractive woman had a crush on you, what would you do about it? If you're a nice guy, you'd probably find yourself parroting some of the same BS lines. Now, how about if a hot but kinda bitchy woman wanted you? Would you go for it? I'm guessing that you would. The solution is to stop thinking of women as being so different from men. Be sexy. Hell, that's what we're expected to do for most of our lives. I'm not going to apologize because something is expected from guys too.

(P.S. As a woman, I find that men who complain like you are usually not nice guys. They're often resentful assholes who refuse to see their own flaws. But, ya know ... it's our fault for not liking you, right?)

title: Typing With an Elephant Arm
text:
Ladies, please, before you look away from my elephant arm in disgust and click to another personal ad featuring a photo of an equi-limbed hunk of a man taken ten years ago, hear me out. It's bad enough that my shirts are tailored to create a right sleeve capable of encasing an oil tanker; or that the only nose I can pick is Teddy Roosevelt's on Mount Rushmore; or that when I go to swat a fly, the result is a twenty inch hole looking into the next apartment, the resident of which is an eighty-year-old lady who likes to parade around in the nude -- yeah, it all sucks, but now I have to type this ad using what amounts to battering rams for fingers.

I would cite the tired cliché about how I am not an animal, I am a man, but, scientifically speaking, I am one-sixth beast and a far-from-unanimous eighty-three percent human male. So, ladies, I want to sell you on the idea that my elephant arm is not only an acceptable extremity but may be my most endearing quality. I may even venture to say that it's what makes me quite the ladies' man, quite the catch.

Would it not be romantic for the two of us, in a Karaoke contest, to perform the song "Stop in the Name of Love," mimicking The Supremes as we, in unison, hold out our palms like a set of policemen stopping traffic, you with your lithesome, well-manicured hand and me with my giant flattened elephant paw? Or we could march in your favorite liberal cause during which I could punch the air with a protesting fist that looks more like a support beam of a skyscraper than an angry leftist mitt, and thus make the evening news, which will help gain national support for an impractical utopia.

Say we are walking along the Nevsky Prospekt in St. Petersburg Russia on a sub-zero degree night and you need an arm to hold for warmth and comfort. Now would a standard-issue human stick limb do the trick? Or would you prefer hugging a tree trunk heated by a Venice-like network of warm blood canals? And as you snuggle around my elephant arm and peak up at me under your Russian fur hood, we will both know that true romance is indeed possible between a beautiful, one-hundred percent woman and an eighty-three percent man.

title: Looking for a long term FWB
text:
Hi there! So if you're one of those people just browsing through the creep-tastic posts here for a laugh, I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to disappoint you-- I'm actually a moderately normal person. I know, I know. It's crazy, but normal people do occasionally post to Craigslist. Though it's kind of like the myth of the honest politician. They all claim to be, but only a tiny fraction of them truly are. It's up to you to figure out who to trust, who to be suspicious of, and who to impeach for lying about a blowjob in the oval office. Though I suppose that last one is only mildly relevant.

So why is a normal person posting here? Well thanks for asking, anonymous peruser of casual sex personals! Honestly, it's because I'm a very quiet person. I'm not shy, I don't lack confidence, I'm not uncomfortable around people, but I just tend to keep most things to myself, which makes it rather difficult to meet people. In addition to that, I'm also very perceptive, very empathic, good at reading people's thoughts and emotions, sensitive and communicate much better physically than I do verbally, whether it's with a touch on the arm, a kiss on the neck, or a hand around the hips.

I only started having sex pretty late (comparatively) in life-- Just a couple years ago. And it turns out those qualities I just listed seem to make me fairly decent at it. However, I tend to be pretty single-minded about things I like. I don't settle for being good at something, or even great at something. If I enjoy it, I want to be the best at it. I've learned a lot about intimacy and physical fulfillment in these last two years, and want to keep learning more. Unfortunately that whole quiet thing I mentioned makes it rather challenging to meet new friends. Hence, back to why I'm posting on Craigslist.

One thing I've discovered is that the better you know someone, the better the sex tends to get, so ultimately I would be looking for a real friends-with-benefits thing. But of course there's really no way to know if you're going to click with someone physically until you start exchanging fluids, so if it doesn't work out, no big deal-- Promise I'm no stalker. (Back to that whole trust thing...)

As for the mundane stats and such... I'm 29 years old, 5'11", lean, athletic build. I put effort in to my appearance, I hope you do too. Just ask for a picture and I'll be more than happy to send one.

As far as age goes-- It's not really a thing to me. You could be 18 or you could be 48 as long as we've got a real connection. So if you're in a similar situation as me, or if you can just sympathize with what I'm saying, get in touch. title: For you on Valentine's Day
text:
Singles can have a hard time today, not having someone special in their lives. It's not so much society's pressure saying we should be part of a couple; it's the loneliness we feel in our soul, wanting to be part of something bigger than ourselves. We have great capacity for love, giving, and happiness; yet, at this moment, it's untapped. I can't bring the joy you yearn for into your lives, but I can send out a wish: I wish everyone who's reading this to find true love.

I'm single, and like you, looking for that special person so we can bring love and fulfillment into each other's lives. I'm confident, humorous, thoughtful, and know what I want in life. I believe love has more power than hate. Through learning about new subjects and each other, we learn more about ourselves. The things that bring us together has more substance that the things that pull us apart. I'm looking for my last and best relationship. Perhaps you are too.

Romantic Sadist

I am a man with simple pleasures and complicated views on the lifestyle. As my moniker indicates, I am a romantic and a sadist. To some this may seem an irreconcilable contradiction, but to me they come hand-in-hand. A person once said to me, "If you cannot beat the one you love, you have no business in the lifestyle." I agree wholeheartedly with that sentiment. There are certain aspects of the HOH and Domestic Discipline that appeal to me and fold themselves into my version of M/s, although I am not much for the religious implications that many associate with that style.

That said, I am more than just a guy who wields a paddle for shits and giggles. I keep a tight circle of friends, and enjoy spending time with those that are dear to me (both in and out of the lifestyle).

While discipline and punishment have their place in my paradigm of M/s relationships, there is also room for affection, encouragement, support, and inspiration. I want my girl to be the best that she can be, and to know that she is no longer adrift in the world all by her lonesome. She can lean on me for strength, and she can draw from my strength. I don't just believe in this as a lofty aspiration, I expect it out of any woman that would be called mine.

The "Master hat" and the "Friend hat" are not two different hats; they are one and the same, and I believe that the coexistence of both makes for a successful and fruitful relationship. While I can be caught jokingly saying,"Do as I say, not as I do," I strive to embody the structure, self-discipline and devotion that I ask for from others.

My girl will be a veritable enigma to many. Not so to me. She is the embodiment of what I've spent many years seeking a woman that, at her core, carries the desire for service and depth, yet has the ability to fulfill my vanilla desires, as well. I have high hopes for her, and high expectations. As she reaches them, the bar will be raised, though never to the point that is out of her grasp. I want her to succeed.

title: MY SUPERPOWER...
text:
My superpower is being invisible. I'm an attractive male who is well dressed, educated with a great job, and am one of the nicest guys out there. I have a lot going for me, but feel like I am invisible when I go out in public. Maybe it is because I don't go out to bars or because I don't get many opportunities to spend time with people my age. In any case it is frustrating being single for as long as I have been especially around Valentine's Day. I don't want to sound cocky, but I think I'm a great catch.

I don't know what I'm expecting posting here. I guess I just hope there is a woman in a similar situation (smart, driven, respectful, genuinely nice, and single!) who would like to take a chance on a good guy who will treat you like you are the only woman in the room. 

I know there is a slim chance for me to find what I would consider a great catch, but to all those who are single on what feels like the loneliest day of the year, know you are not alone.

title: Valentine seeking Loving Old Fashion Commitment with a Fun Active Lady
text:
I am a single white guy. Professional degree. Seeking a Lady. If the chemistry were mutual, who would actually want to spend the rest of their lives with someone. This does not necessarily mean a 'legal' marriage, but certainly a commitment to stand by each other, no matter what life circumstances may throw at us. Essentially to 'love and to hold' in a loving partnership, where our life as a 'team' takes precedence over the individual

I seek an equal partner in daily live, with a traditional 1950's life style at home and in the bedroom. A lady who can hold her own in making a living, and wants a man to love and ravish her when home alone. A lady strong enough to be her own person and WANTS a committed loving partner, and NOT as a NEED to feel fulfilled.

I am a homeowner who paid off my home over a decade ago, and seek a Lady with similar resources who has also saved for retirement and not buried in debt. Someone who has 10 to 15 years of productive and meaningful work left in them, before an active retirement that does not revolve around hanging out at a golf course or beach.

I hope we have some similar interests including: outdoor activities, hearing bands and music made with actual instruments, several friendships who are like family, and who is able to sleep in a tent or a 5 star Hotel, as well enjoy simple food fixed by the side of a remote campfire as well as a nice restaurant. 

I'm seeking someone with traditional Colorado 'outdoor values' , who does not think of being invited to a wedding where guests are invited bring a tent as an 'odd event'. Someone who can handle a four mile hike up a 1,000 elevation gain, or 'deal with it' should our Jeep break down on a remote trail. Someone who is not afraid of a firearm, but would only hunt if it meant survival. Someone who can 'take it or leave it' , when it comes to Alcohol or Marijuana, and does not rely on a pharmacy or street bought chemicals to keep them 'in balance'. 

I will not be running any marathons, or doing day long bike races, but if you do, I would indeed be there as your 'support'. Curvy is sexy, as long as you're active and not glued to a couch. Activity level is more important than body fat numbers. Someone who likes bacon and beer, but NOT as a staple diet, who can also enjoy hummus and sushi.

I'm a REAL man and I want a REAL woman who still believes that REAL love is possible! 

So put IM FOR REAL in the SUBJECT line of your reply. Describe yourself , interest, activities and desires. A photo would be nice, but what will get me to reply is an honest descriptive answer that shows you read this, and are indeed living in Colorado.

Happy Valentines Day Sweety !!! 
We may have missed celebrating this 'holiday' together, but we will have so many more to share.
XOXXO

title: CAN'T SLEEP. UP LATE THINKING...
text:
. . . how crappy my love life is and how women aren't into nice and stable guys. Yes this is probably going to turn into a rant and I'm going to say things I wouldn't normally say, but I really need to get some things off of my chest. I'm the type of guy who keeps things bottled up since I don't have anyone to vent to so maybe there is someone out there who is reading this.

I am 26 years old and have only been in one relationship. She was one of the few women I have felt a real connection with. We dated for 2 years and never fought. She cheated on me after we moved in together and it just killed me how she could throw all we went through together like it was nothing. I mean I was going through the worst time of my life and it didn't even seem to phase her. 5 years have past and nobody has shown the slightest interest in me. I mean I have an athletic build and wouldn't say I'm terrible to look at. I am intelligent, athletic, have a great job, good sense of humor, am very respectful, and am a genuinely nice guy.

Post breakup, I got to the point where I felt content being single. After you are single for a while, it really starts to wear on you. I mean when you go out to the store or any place for that matter, why does everybody have to be in a relationship? I feel like I'm the only one who hasn't really dated and it isn't for a lack of trying. I got so lonely that I have tried pretty much every online dating site over the last 5 years. I have sent well over a thousand messages and out of those, I have probably only gotten responses for 7. Out of those 7, I only went on 1 date that didn't lead to anything else. I bet few women know what it is like to feel like you are constantly being rejected. You get to the point where it hurts so much that you give up trying. I could normally bring myself to feel a little better about being single, but then I started the whole process over again. That is I get to the point where I can't stand being single, go back to trying online dating, feel like I'm constantly being rejected, and go back to convincing myself being single is a viable solution. I think to try to cope with this I started to spend a lot of money on myself. I buy nice things for myself because I feel like I'm the only person who could possibly care for me. I don't know if that makes any sense or not.

Lately I haven't been able to convince myself being single is okay and it is killing me. Maybe it is because I moved in with a few roommates and both of them are constantly having sex and it reminds me how crappy my love life is. I mean I think everybody needs physical contact with the opposite sex and I just have never had luck in that department. I mean I have only been with 1 woman and it has been 4 years since I have had any physical contact with anyone. I can't stop thinking about making out, cuddling, and having sex with someone probably because it has been so long. I'm getting to the point where I am so sexually frustrated that I really don't know how to cope anymore. I'm not the kind of guy who wants to have a one night stand either. I want a real, long term, committed relationship, but can't seem to find one.

I'm really starting to wonder if anyone has/is going through a similar situation or if it is just me.

Well if you are still reading, you are probably the only one! I would love to hear from you. Put "Frustrated" in the subject line so I can weed out spam and tell me about yourself and why you responded.

title: I haven't slept for 10 hours.... because that would be too long.
text:
So, here I am, pondering some of life's great questions, such as: Why do they call them "apartments", when they are so close together? Why do you park on a driveway, and drive on a parkway? If you shoot a mime, should you use a silencer? If you're sending someone some Styrofoam, what do you pack it in? Why doesn't glue stick to the inside of the bottle? And of course, the all important Ginger or Maryann? (Okay. . .so, that one's easy. . ..Mrs. Howell! always go for the chick with money! ;)

You know, I never thought I'd be writing here. Until this one time late at night, when I was traveling down a dark, deserted country road, and came across a broken-down bus full of drunk cheerleaders. When all of a sudden-- oh crap! Sorry. Wrong publication.... (and if you GET that joke, I'm at once very intrigued and very concerned :)

Let's see now....exactly how does one stand out on a Craigslist personals board....? Oh! I know... I can SPELL, I know that "grammar" ain't your mother's mother, and I know the difference between "your" and "you're", between "then" and "than", and the biggie, "their", "there", and "they're"!! So, I figure that that makes me stand out on here like a Rhodes Scholar, huh? :)

Now, a little about me: I'm a 52 year old man with the body of a 20 year old. (Though, I hope the cops never find it!) Ok, ok, so I'm a 52 year old with the body of...well, a 52 year old. So sue me. Actually, go ahead and sue me. Because, my attorney is SO good, she can get Sodomy reduced down to "following too closely" *rimshot* And then, there was this one time where I got arrested for "indecent exposure", and she not only got it sent down to Small Claims Court, but ultimately thrown out for lack of evidence! But, I digress....

I'm successful, own my own small company and have bought my own house and car (which was REALLY stupid...I should have bought someone else's...sigh). If you're easily impressed (my kinda woman) I should tell you that I also have a huge. . ..portfolio ;) And, I'm kind of like a portfolio too. Date me, and I'll pay dividends in the long run ;) (you were expecting an "up and down" joke here, huh? :) Before I started my own company, I worked for many years at a pickle factory. But I was fired from there for sticking my finger in the pickle slicer....(though to be fair, SHE was fired too!)

I'm a musician, play saxophone and sing, but I don't ski. (Although, I HAVE been going downhill for years.) I like to think that I have a good sense of humor, am fairly attractive and highly intelligent. (I'm only single, because no one else seems to think so. . .sigh) And, let me just say that when it comes to sex and dating, I can certainly hold my own. (although, I really try NOT to too often :)

I should also probably mention here that if you don't like cats, you should move on. Because I currently have one sweet, wonderful cat (and 1 out of 2 ain't bad!) For a while, I was considering changing my name to "Claude Bawls", but...

If you'd like to send me a photo, that would be great. But, I won't insist on one because physical attributes aren't as important to me as mental attributes. Mental attributes are far more intriguing (you're going to have to have those, though. And I mean the attributes. You can't just be mental) And, as the old saying goes, "Beauty fades...dumb is forever!" Also, my physical tastes in women aren't the norm anyway, so you never know. But, if you're confident, intelligent, kind and have a good sense of humor (you don't even have to have humor...just a sense of it) then I'd love to hear from you And, ok, at the risk of sounding shallow, I'd love to SEE you too. So, even though it's optional..send a photo so at least then I'd know you're not a bot! :)

Now, if you're still reading this. . .what the hell is wrong with you? Get off the computer, and go do something! After writing to ME, of course ;)

title: MARRIAGE WITHIN THE YEAR
text:
Maybe I'm being a little too forward, but I want to be married within the next year. I am sick and tired of what dating has come to these days. I don't know when things changed from having meaningful relationships to having one-night stands, but this generation disgusts me. Do people respect themselves anymore and actually care to get to know someone before having sex? There must be something wrong with me because I believe in having as few sexual partners as possible. That seems to be the opposite of the norm. 

I would consider myself one of the more intelligent individuals out there, but dating baffles me. I just can't understand how dating has evolved into its current form. Putting our generations desire for instant gratification and casual sex aside, online dating has changed the way people date and not for the better. Women get hundreds of messages and get addicted to meeting new people. They have a phobia of settling down because they have a plethora of unopened messages and either are hooked on the thrill of meeting new guys or believe someone better is waiting in the unopened pile of messages. Here is an article that sums up my online dating experience over the last several years (search google for "online dating sucks because of women like me"). It has been a frustrating journey and I am sick of this generation. I am a great catch and one of the few genuinely nice guys out there who gets passed by because women don't know a good thing when it is right in front of them. People are more interested in dating around than developing a meaningful relationship like in the decades past and online dating has encouraged this destructive behavior. I usually bike on bicycle trails in the Denver metro area riding between 15 and 30 miles. I ride slowly. My average speed is between 10 and 12 miles an hour. I have ridden around the Aurora Reservoir, Chatfield Dam, Standley Lake, Barr Lake, Cherry Creek Dam, Sloan's Lake, Bear Creek Lake, up and down the Platte River to Confluence Park, the Cherry Creek Trail, the Clear Creek Trail, and the Highline Canal path. 
I walk in open spaces in Jefferson County, Boulder County , and Douglas County. I hike between 2 and 15 miles. I have been thinking about walking up Mt. Bierstadt and walking into Lake Abyss this summer.
I drive all over Colorado mostly day trips and an occasional overnight trip. I mostly drive in the mountains and not so much on the eastern plains although I have done both. I have driven over 23 mountain passes in the past two years. I still have some more to drive over. Occasionally I do some four wheel driving.
If these are things you would enjoy doing, please get in touch. One thing that may make me difficult to get along with is that I am very impulsive and impromptu. I will sit down at night and decide to go for a bicycle ride, a hike, or a drive the next morning. I don't mind if you do, however. I am very 420 feiendly, and I ask that you are too, or at least can deal with me doing it. Hit me up, tell me about yourself. Pic for pic.

title: A Beautiful Feminine Woman
text:
I am in a way like a fish out of water or more like a male fish swimming around with a bunch of other fish that used to be females... I say this because I am old enough to remember when women actually dressed and acted like women, and men actually were gentlemen, and together, they went out on dates, and had intellectually stimulating conversations together. In todays twisted world, it seems the status quo is to exchange a bunch of texts, and or emails, and most times you never actually end up going on an actual "date". Or if you do go on an actual date the "woman" might show up in a Broncos Jersey, or a Trucker Hat and expect you to talk about something as simple as "The Game" or another equally idiotic subject, and expect that this is going to lead into something interesting...

I just don't get it. I remember when romance was exciting, when women actually took care of themselves. They were beautiful and proud, and feminine and sexy. Remember the women in the James Bond Movies? Yes I know, some of these women were promiscuous, and I know that was Hollywood, painting an image for men to enjoy. However, on the flip side, many of these women, portrayed class, and elegance, and dignity, and beautify and intelligence. They actually dressed in beautiful dresses that accentuated their beautiful feminine bodies. They could actually hold a stimulating conversation, and they enjoyed it when "James" would open the door for them, or pull out a chair, or bring them champagne in bed... Where is the Romance today? Please tell me where it went?

Who am I? what am I about? First of all, I was raised by two beautiful parents, who will be celebrating there 60th wedding anniversary soon, who were school teachers, musicians and artists. They were morally conservative (which I am not) but they were liberal when it came to most other beliefs and ideals. I have been an executive in the corporate world for many years and now I own my own business. I am also a published writer of two Sci Fi novels. I am a civil rights activist, and a believer of a better world. I am also an outdoor adventurer, a practitioner of martial arts, occasionally yoga, and an avid river-water person, being in the water on a board, or a raft is where I feel most alive...

Meanwhile, I of course would like to find a beautiful feminine woman, who would appreciate a gentlemen, with many, adventurous, rugged playful qualities. A woman with an amazing brain inside her head, and an equally amazing body who does not settle for silly small-talk, who surely does not want to talk about something as silly as "The Game" or Donald Trump... Someone who would like to explore the mysterious, taboo realms together...Are you out there? I am open to all ages close to me and younger... Is there any hope for a man like me?

title: Why I'll never succeed in the M4W forum!
text:
I've been an avid reader, occasional poster and extremely rare responder of the Craigslist personals for about a year now, and I've noticed some common (and hilarious) threads of interest among the women of Denver. I'd like to take a minute to break it down for you, ghetto style, so you can recognize the following horrific cliches and just maybe avoid getting flagged as spam.

ReadySetGo!!!!

"Must love animals" -- Great. . . You mean I have to pretend to like your floofy poodle/chihuahua/norway rat mixed breed long enough to maybe earn some kisses? Or that huge mastiff that's physically capable of kicking me out of your bed? How about the cat that's contemplating using my balls as a scratching post every time I walk around in my boxers? I think I'll exit stage right before the fucker eats my socks again.

"Looking for a God-fearing man" -- I get the biggest kick out of this one. Why would you be afraid of your own imaginary friend? Seems like you'd better imagine something a little less hostile. I'd suggest Papa Smurf.

"Must like the outdoors" -- Barring a select few dweebs I've met that live in their parents' basement and mainline Mountain Dew so they can play World of Warcraft for 87 hours straight, most human beings like being outside at some point. Sure, I'll go for a day hike with you. Does that mean I want to live in the woods for a month and wipe my ass with a pine cone? No thanks!

"Looking for friends first" -- Cool, I'm always down for more friends. Wait, what's that you say? Your hot friend Brittany is single? Excuse me while I ask her for her phone number.

"Must love children" -- Unlike the mighty lion (who will kill and eat cubs from rival males) I say the more kids, the better! We can open our own sweatshop and they can make you shoes. I call being the manager!

"I like having fun" -- Whew, what a relief! I'm meeting too many people these days that think having fun sucks. I'm a big fan of fun myself! We have so much in common.

"Must like to dance" -- Really? Have you ever met a straight guy that wants to go dancing? Wait, I take that back. I do know one guy, but he's from Puerto Rico or something. Come to think of it, he's probably gay. That's right, Jorge -- I've got you figured out.

"I like going out, but also enjoy staying in for a quiet night at home" -- That's great, because staying home or going out and doing something are pretty much the only two options you have.

So in conclusion, I say the luck of the Irish be with you lovely ladies of Denver in your search for a badass Daniel Craig-era James Bond lookalike that will dance the Macarena with Mr. Cuddlekins the Poodle whilst purchasing you an all-expenses-paid vacation to Maui. Just keep in mind that Mr. Bond is only 5'10.

title: Divorced/Single Father, just looking for companionship
text:
tryING this again...lol


About me - I'm a recently divorced (3 yrs ago) single father to an amazing little 5 year old girl that is the center of my universe. I have a career, I have a car, I'm stable. I don't do drugs (420 friendly), I drink only socially, and I definitely don't smoke. I'm 35 years old brown hair/eyes, and yes, thanks to genes handed down from my father I have greys, lol. I'm tall, six foot two, and fit, one ninety five. I'm not a gym rat with a shredded six pack and huge biceps, but I don't look too bad without any clothes on, lol. I'm no Brad Pitt, but I'm not Chris Farley either. I HATE the club scene, don't mind the sports bar scene, don't care for the live music scene, but those are definitely not deal breakers. I love just kickin back, hanging out, watching a movie or some bad TV, lol. I like to think I'm not a nerd, but I kind've am, lol. I love watching The Big Bang Theory, or pretty much any other good sitcom. I prefer cuddling on the couch watching TV to being out at a loud bar. I like going to Rockies games, playing volleyball at Wash Park, things like that...you get the idea. I'm into old cars, motorcycles, comedy shows, sports...typical guy stuff...

Now, since I'm newly divorced I'm in that lonely state of limbo, lol. I'm NOT looking for a booty call, I'm NOT looking to jump into something serious, and I'm NOT looking sleep around. I'm much more interested in making a solid connection with someone. Not really looking for a fwb type of situation, but not exactly something strictly plutonic either...I dunno...I miss having a deeper connection with someone special, but not desperate for a significant other either. 

What I am looking for is someone either in a similar situation (divorced, separated, or ...?), or simply someone who can understand and respect my situation and doesn't expect the world from me. I'm not in a position to go on lavish, expensive dates. I can't take you on weekend vacations out of town. I can't take you to expensive concerts, or whatever. Not for a while, anyway. But does that mean I can't be a good companion for someone out there? Is there not someone out there who also is lonely, and just wants to have that "person" that they can call, or text, and just shoot the breeze with, hang out and cuddle up and watch a movie or .....? Just talk about the day, or what's on tv, or what's bothering you in your situation/life? Seems like a lot of women these dates want a sugar daddy, or to be spoiled beyond belief. Well, I have no interest in being somebodies sugar daddy...

About you - first and foremost, selfishness is the biggest turn off of mine. If you're one of those control seeking women looking for a man to follow you around and do what you say, and dare not say anything - keep looking. You won't get passed the first date. I was married to that, never want it again. As far as looks go, like I said, I'm no Brad Pitt and I don't care if you're Angelina Jolie. I don't care how big or small your boobs are (love 'em both!), or how big or small your butt is (again, I love 'em both!). I don't care if you're blonde, brunette, whatever. I don't care if you're skinny or chubby. That being said, obesity is just not something I can be attracted too. I'm not talking like one hundred forty lbs - I'm talking like one eighty plus. Sorry, you girls are beautiful and I'm sure it's my loss.

I don't care if you're nerdy, artsy, athletic, or a lazy video gaming couch potato. If you're open minded, looking for companionship, and respectfull of my situation -- we should talk! Yes, I have pictures if you want to see them, but I'm not going to post them here for what should be extremely obvious reasons, lol.

So if by some crazy chance you're still reading this, we should talk! Open to just hanging with some new friends too...

2-6-2016 - Solo adventure #1 Dinner review #1 Red Robin in Denver West. Very good place to eat and have a brew. Some of the drinks watered down. Other wise good food and customer service. Was greeted well by the hostess gave suggestions of the bar. Walked into Bar. place is kept clean. Very good customer service. Was checked on quite frequently. Place opened up in Fall of 2015. Had very good help from the Bar tender on food suggestions and drink suggestion. Went to the Mountain Tap in golden off of 20th and Young's field in Applewood., very simple looking, Typical hole in the wall joint. Good customer service, probably could use a little more staff help. Not a huge drink selection to choose from. Basic bar food Menu. Couple of dart pits, and pool tables and video games, Kinda has the theme of a Ole Mountain town watering hole. Almost every age range to choose from on a Saturday night. didn't try their food. Drink delivery service kinda slow. not a huge crowd. promotes a Super Bowl Party. That I might check out. Good Canadian Whiskey 100 proof to choose from. Bottle beers range from 3.50 to 4.50. not my first choice to hang out. 

off to rate another area in Golden.
hiv/hsv/hpv: None plan on staying that way.

Oh, aren't we all unique? Simultaneously are we not all alike beneath a fascade we hide beneath?

hot springs, massages, talking, reading, hiking, biking, building furniture, building indoor stone fountains, being with my daughters, entertaining, baking/cooking, photography, volunteering, helping others..........

title: Dipping a toe in the water...
text:
Well, it appears that I'm going to have this Valentine's Day all to myself for the first time in quite a few years, & honestly, the prospect of sitting home & watching TV that night just isn't especially appealing, so I'm wondering if there's a lady out there who might be compatible enough for me to enjoy the (non-sexual) evening with.

I am a tall, professional drug/disease-free white male in my late-40s (although some have said that I look younger), separated, no kids, full head of hair. I'm physically in fairly-decent shape, I have a moderately-demanding workout routine that I've been committed to for the last several years, & I'd like to find a lady with a similar commitment, someone who's active enough to hike with, or go whitewater rafting (class-III to class V) with. Quite honestly, at this point I'm not looking for an LTR so much as I'm looking for a friend (or maybe more than one) to help me keep a decent perspective while I adjust to my new reality. Maybe I'll be looking for "more" a bit later, but let's keep it mellow for the moment.

I have smoked a fair bit of weed in my younger days, but I've pretty much outgrown that by now, so if "420-friendly" is a big deal for you, you'll want to move on to the next posting. I can't stand cigarettes either, that's a deal-breaker for me. "Curvy" is great - as long as it doesn't really mean "chubby", "Rubenesque" or "obese" (YES, I know that makes me "a jerk," but I'm sorry - I just want someone who has a build that's reasonably similar to my own, & I can't spend any more time pretending to be attracted to something that I'm simply NOT attracted to.). 

I am literate, reasonably-intelligent, mildly-well-traveled (I've been to most parts of the U.S., & three foreign countries), and an incurable smart-ass! I was a BIG Broncos fan until fairly recently (when I realized how much time that I was spending watching the NFL), & I can still thoroughly enjoy the game from time to time. I've also been known to grill a decent steak, or whip up a tasty stir-fry or killer Pad Thai. As you may have guessed, I love most Asian food, but I'm always up for trying something new. I keep up on current events, & if the conversation becomes political, I am a pretty strong conservative (with no apologies for that). I am NOT the type of guy who will send anyone a "dick pic" (c'mon guys, REALLY?!??), I have way too much respect for myself/hold myself to a MUCH higher standard than that.

So, if you're a drama/drug/disease-free, reasonably-intelligent/reasonably-attractive single/divorced white (or perhaps Asian/American Indian?) lady between the ages of 33?-45? who isn't scared off by the above, I'd enjoy hearing from you. I'd like to start off with email, then maybe grabbing a cup of coffee & learning a bit more about you. :)


(Bonus points if you mention one of your favorite movies, & tell me what you loved about it. I'll reply with the same.) With any luck, we can make Valentine's Day 2016 a memory that we enjoy!

Thanks for reading, I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Do you like to be on Top?
text:
In most aspects of my life I am very much in charge of things when it comes to work, interactions with friends, etc. However, I do find myself very attracted to strong women and while I'm in favor of a generally equal relationship, surrendering control from time to time is fun.

I'm an active individual- I work out on a regular basis and enjoy a number of active outdoor activities. I'm also well-educated with an advanced degree and a good job that allows me some flexibility with my time. Physically, I'm 5'8", 165 lbs., mostly bald with blue eyes.

I have a good sense of humor, a good imagination and give a great massage... think about it! Especially if you do like being on top :-) ... I'd be happy to trade pics if you're interested...

title: Zika Virus is coming, lets have a baby!
text:
Well, that's it, the apocalypse is here. Zika virus causes microcephaly, or smaller than normal heads in babies. In South America, they are telling women to put off pregnancy for a few years. Now, the first case has been reported in America, thanks to Texas. Yikes!

So here's the idea, we have a baby now, before the virus spreads, so that humans can repopulate the planet after this virus destroys the worlds population. We will stay north where there are no mosquitos, and keep to ourselves so we don't contract it otherwise. Maybe an isolated cabin on a mountain? A beautiful place, next to the woods, and there is a lake nearby, so we will have plenty of fresh water. Occasionally, I will go to town for supplies, wearing a can of Off bug repellant, and avoiding people and bugs.

You: A fertile woman of childbearing age, average looks are ok, but fitness is important, as we will be hiking and bathing in mountain streams and stuff like that, and you will need to be healthy enough for having a baby. A decent personality, reasonable level of education and sense of humor will be necessary. Hearty. The ability to be holed up in a cabin in the woods for months or years while this plague passes.

Me: Independently wealthy with a stash of gold bullion hidden on that mountain. I'll take care of you while you birth our normal-size-headed offspring. Healthy: I just visited a doctor, and once this knee heals up I'll be right as rain, and able to haul all our supplies up that hill. I'll get a Jeep, and lots of gas, too. 

The birth: I'll also hire a midwife to water-birth our kid, or, hey, kids - the world will need them! She can also help with other chores and stuff, and incase you are infertile after all, you can midwife her, and then help us raise the baby. (Hey, I gotta have some redundancy here, right? I mean, this shows what a thorough thinker I am about this things....)

So that's the scheme! I think it will work, but if it doesn't, well, at least we tried to save the human race. Oh well, no more humans... 

Hit me up ladies, pic for pic!

title: *insert witty title here*
text:
Hello! I am a 43 year old man who is looking for that special someone. I am average sized, white, and have blond hair and blue eyes. title: So, I don't usually do this....
text:
Hi!,
So I've come to the conclusion that working nights and finding someone worth while is nearly impossible. Especially since it seems that most everyone I've met out at night is more concerned with social status, and material goods rather than actual happiness (can't blame y'all for looking for security but it can't compare to real happiness). I don't think I'm going to find what I'm looking for in the local bars and such on a Monday or Wednesday night... Or prolly any night really but I go out anyway in hopes to come across someone fun and amazing. Sadly, this strategy has given me Nada. I refuse to be some weird stalker at the library, and not one for hitting on girls I work with (could get ugly if things go wrong), so I stay seemingly perpetually single, and I'm tired of it.
I have to much to offer to the right person and I'd hate to see these good yrs wasted. I feel I deserve a bit of happiness myself, and appreciated for the effort I give in making YOU the most important part of my day. 
Anyways, a bit about me: I'm 34 and 6' tall, thin but not skinny, brown hair, blue eyes. Working on quitting cigs, but am 420 friendly, I also enjoy a few beers after work, but not a drunk by any means, but do like a good bottle of wine with a home cooked meal(especially meals cooked together). I dance a lot. I'm also always looking for the next adventure, moving to a new town/ meeting new people ... Whatever! Anyways, if any of this interests you toss me an email. 
Pic for pic ?

title: My job. Your job. (25-35 ish)
text:
Men and women have unspoken expectations for each other. I expect a certain amount of things from you and you expect different, but just as signficant things from me. It's not a contract or a career, technially. But the reality is that what I want and what you want should be agreed upon, from the beginning. So there are no questions later My work is to be decisive when you say "what do you want to do tonight?" My work is NOT to say, "I dunno, what do you want to do?" It is my work to say, "I would like to [verb here] to [insert place] and [activity here]. Yet, I must also know when you have your own idea and actually want me to say, "I don't know, what about you?" How should I know? That's my work as a man. I know.

My work is to pay for dinner. My work is to be ambitious in my career and make enough money that if we live together and your career takes a turn for the worse - I would have the money to afford to keep you fed and healthy AND SEXY (we will talk about you being SEXY below).

My work is make you feel safe. If I have to act like a psycho killer once in a while when someone is being threatening around you and endangering your well being, even if it means I might end up in jail for the night (when I break his arm and jaw for trying to rape you), I do it. Yet I need to know when to be cool and aloof most of the time when you are just engaged in friendly flirting. I will not feel threatened when guys stare at you, not be jealous when they flirt, and not be insecure when you flirt back. I'll just relax and enjoy your happiness. I am not jealous by nature so this is easy. But the moment a guy mistakes one of your signals (which happens because you don't quite realize all the signals you give off) and starts trying to do something to you against your will, I need to be ready to be incarcerated after I make him sorry. That's fine. Hopefully it will never get that far and my sharp tongue will scare him off, but I know what I am supposed to do if it does get that far and I will tell the judge that I had to break the guys ribs because it was what I am supposed to do. I am here for you. I recognize that obligation. I agree to it every day when I put my pants on, or when we take a photo and you have to lean into me. We don't have photos of me sitting in your lap.

It is also my work to be funny and entertaining yet a little dark and mysterious at times. Don't ask me how either. But, I can do it. You can't teach that by the way. God forbid you should be able to figure me out entirely. Your boredom means the end of good sex, orgasm and eventually the relationship. Or it just means the beginning of the nagging and bitching, which neither of us want. I realize that. I accept that. I have to be your clown, yet keep your respect. Get you to laugh at me, but not reduce my prowess in your eyes. It is a fine line. It is my work to walk it and know how to keep mystery alive, maintain your respect and awe of me as a man and at the same time make you smile when you need it and keep things light when you get too lost in your intensity.

My work is to intuit, using my sexual psychic powers, when you need to be objectified and fucked like an animal (yet still ensuring your orgasm) or spanked or hair pulled, or more, and when you need gentle love like what you saw in that romantic movie you watched. I need to also magically know when you want it quick and urgent and when you want it to take all night. And when you scream the very painful words "fuck me harder," even whilst I am fucking as hard as I can and running out of breath, it is my work to find a way to do it harder. Yes, it is tough, but it is my work, I accept it. All the hours I spend at the gym will help me fuck harder when I am supposed to. And somehow, most of the time, I have to figure all this out without anything but your body language and your subtle female hints. Fine, it may not be easy, but I accept it and I do my best because this is how it works. And I like the challenge. And the action.

It is my work to make you feel comfortable to express yourself to me, to listen, to show you I care (without ever caring too much). I have to care for you and show love without ever making you feel that I am more sensitive than you, more emotional, more emotionally intelligent, sweeter or more romantic. If I cross those lines, you will run from me and say I am too nice - or just not feel complete because I am walking in your territory as a woman. Again, that's fine with me. I know the line, I will walk on the right side of it and I will accept responsibility when I screw up. I will be your listener and still ignore you at the right time, or fuck you like a bar room whore when I need to. I can figure out what to do when, or at least accept that it is my work to figure all of that out. Call me a multi-tasker. No one taught me that. I had to figure it out. When you get into a car accident, and the guy you hit is yelling at you and you call me on the cell phone, I need to be able to drop what I am doing and effectively manage whatever tragedy has occurred. Sure, you can do it yourself - you might even resent girls who are helpless in such situations - I am not criticizing your skill set here at all. I am just saying that when tragedy goes down, and you are in need of help, I will be there to take care of it. The relationship requires that I be able to stay calm and solve problems when you can't. And you know you can smell fear in a man. If you catch the slightest hint that I am just as intimidated by the tragedy as you are, forget it, I will sit in your lap for the next photo. Of course there are tragedies where you need to take charge - I will cover that in a few minutes.

You will have to do your part as well. If one of us fails to perform his/her role, the arrangement crumbles and I become an asshole and/or you become a nagging bitch. I know. I have seen it on TV, in the grocery store on a Saturday morning, in restaurants etc... It's all around us. All the couples fighting - where you can just feel their bitter energy and you know they are doomed - that's why. One of them did not step up and the relationship is crumbling. And you say, "no, maybe it was something else." Perhaps. But most likely it is what I am talking about here. There are many things for you too. Your first and last task are the same. The rest of the list is important too, but they don't work if you don't do your first task first. Your first task is to be SEXY. It is your task to discover your own natural sexiness, manifest it, AND your task to figure out what I think is sexy. How do you normally attract men? 

I have heard girls get upset about this. They say, "it is not my task to be sexy all the time," or "It is not my task to meet your definitions of sexy." And I say, bullshit. Have you never stepped outside? It IS your task. It may not be your task to be sexy ALL the time, but you better believe it is your task to be sexy when you are around me, my friends, our friends, and the neighbors. I am not saying you have to dress up, I am only saying you need to figure out where/what and how to create your sexiness and make sure I agree with it. Sure you can have your off-days where you don't change your underwear until noon the following day, or you are bloated and gassy and you just can not be sexy. That's ok - I like girls who are real - I will still love you. I know you fart and get acne in strange places sometimes and have all kinds of biological processes that are esoteric to me - those things don't turn me off either, after all I like real girls. I just ask that you manage and control the things that are in your control. But don't let me catch you eating pork sticks everyday and then complain that your stomach hurts and you have the runs for weeks or put on 5 pounds.

You be sexy. Eat right, wear sexy underwear (which I will gladly buy for you), comb your hair and as you dress in the morning DON'T ask yourself, "will this outfit make guys at the county fair want to jerk off on me? If yes, then change and stop wearing shirts with your name airbrushed on them. Ask something like, "Would this look turn my man off if I were giving him head and he were looking at me." or "would my man be proud to walk with me in this outfit?" This question will keep you from dressing like your grandmother, a nun and the lonely women that you work. Don't be that woman. You be sexy. Ask the right questions when dressing in the morning.

I want to love the sexy girl who will occasionally be ugly. Not the girl with no taste who once in a while gets lucky and looks nice. Now, I don't want to discourage girls who feel unsexy most of the time. In cases like that - I just ask you to not book me on those days - lets have some away time.

And you need to be able to figure out when not to be sexy, like: when meeting my perverted father, when I am sick in a hospital bed, incapacitated and unable to move, but only able to see that some male interns and you are talking about my condition. At that moment you need to be clinical and NOT sexy; when you are at the dentists office and he is about to put you under (wear ugly stuff), when I am feeling down on life and we go to a party - don't be hot, you are only going to get me to sink lower. Just be nice looking or better yet, suggest that we cancel and have some "us" time.

I can not tell you how to locate your inner sexiness - but I can offer you some advice on how to avoid being unsexy.

Unsexy: always wearing a seamless sports bra, especially girls who don't play any sports and have no athletic ability (unless complaining and nagging count. I dont count them). Fine for sporting times or gym time, very sexy when sweaty - I may grab you and want to get animalistic on you. But to wear them on a day to day basis because they are comfy is to completely give up on life, or to say "I have a boyfriend now, nothing matters anymore." You do your task and stay sexy and I promise to work-out regularly, keep my cholesterol low, dress well, pluck my ear hairs, get laser hair removal wherever else, not leave you hanging when it is your turn to orgasm and not to wear my dirty sweat pants. Just you keep your sports bra for work-out time.

Unsexy: Bras with big thick (wide) straps in the back or over the shoulders. That's just weird. Ok, at times it is necessary, like when you are all swollen up from breast feeding and you need more strap-strength to hold your product in place. Or if you have a very large chest. Under what assumption are you operating where you concluded that the "nursing" look was sexy? Unless you want men to suckle you in a child-rearing kind of way, wear something else - lace is nice.

Unsexy: photos of yourself cramming food in your mouth, or cookies or an alcoholic beverage. Or photos with your mouth gaping open as if you are wasted and screaming at a party. I am out here working out, staying in shape and taking care of myself - for what? For you to cram cookies and beer into your mouth, run around drunk with your jaw hanging open? and take photos? No. We will not date.

Unsexy: Your growing gut. Pooch like Maya Rudolph - very hot. Gut like post high school ex-jock? It is diet time.

Unsexy: panties with little cutesy polka dots on them or any pattern that looks like something a 4 yr old girl would wear at her pajama party. Save those for when you feel puffy and bloated and want to snuggle with your stuffed animals and eat chocolate ice cream.

Sexy: girls who take care of themselves physically and emotionally. Girls who manage aspects of themselves that are in their control. Meaning, I don't care if you are short, tall or medium, have huge breasts or no breasts, brown hair or red hair, enormous feet or a funny nose - you have little control over what you were given. So I don't judge those things. I just ask you to take care of what is yours to take care of. Don't tell me that your ass is fat because that is your body type - and then shovel lasagna down your throat 3 days a week. We have a deal. I will do my part. You do yours. Stay thin - meaning if you are 130 pounds - you need to stay around 125 to 135. I like slender girls or muscular or thin or thinner than average. Slender does not equal thick. If you look like Minnie Driver or Kate Winslet - then your excess weight is hot and I love it.

Your other tasks are very important as well. It is your task to nurture. If I am down and not feeling so great, you need to be building me back up. You need to be reading self-help books once in a while and see to it that we are both emotionally balanced. You need to make sure that we both communicate what is bothering us and all that stuff that you women want us to talk about in relationships. I need that. Do your work, I respect it. And when I am not feeling like such a man, you need to find it in yourself, even if you have to fake it, to build me right back into the alpha male that I should be.

Your task is to lean into me when we take a photo - but you should know that. Your task is to find it in yourself to want to do things that the last 3 decades told you were not women's work. You know - the huge double standard - how you were taught that it isn't your task to do anything that your dad expected your mom to do, yet you still expect me to open doors for you, fuck you like the world is ending, be strong, buy you nice things when I can, make money, jump in front of a bullet for you, provide security for you, take initiative and make you feel safe. Well you don't get it both ways. I told you I would do my work. You must do yours. Personally, I like to cook and clean, do my own laundry and wash dishes and I am not asking you to do ANYTHING for me. But if I need help in that area - you better put on an apron and cook some food, or make the bed, or offer to make sandwiches on rare occasions when my friends are over, or do some laundry or fold something, sweep - whatever because you WANT to do it. Again, I am not asking you to do those things, I will do them myself when they need doing. Your task is not to be my maid at all, your task is to WANT to care for me in those ways and/or offer or just jump in and help when I am doing it myself. I will help you too - but don't refuse to do stuff because you feel offended because you learned in your college class that men oppress women. Personally, I only know oppressed men and frustrated women. Men afraid to be men and women who are frustrated with them.

But its harder than that. And you can blame your feminist aunt. You have to figure out how to be all that while also being modern and knowing how to hang with the guys. Don't ask me to explain that - I would not know how to pull it off. But I have some tough work to do that I can't explain either.

You do that, and when the guy is shooting at us I will take the bullet. When the bad man is attacking you, I will make him sorry. When you wreck your car - I will get it fixed. When you break your leg, I will carry you to the hospital. When the heater doesn't work, I will chop wood. But believe me, if you refuse to do your part you can walk yourself to the hospital with a broken leg and bullet in your chest while fleeing the bad guy - because I will have left you.

You are in charge of the our emotional health. Even if I say I am fine. When you notice that I have some unresolved issue that I need to work on, I have to listen and do whatever it takes - even if it means seeing a therapist or counseling or reading some stupid book. You are in charge and you must find a way to do this without ever being bossy or over-critical. How do you do that? I don't know. It's a tough task and only you can do it. My work is not easy either.

Your task is also to be in charge of our morality. If we are at a dinner party and I say something a little mean to someone and you notice it. It is your task to pull me aside and say, "that was wrong - you go and apologize because you hurt that persons feelings." I won't like it - but I will obey. You are doing your task and I respect it. I will somehow find a way to go apologize.

When we are having friends over for dinner and I say that it doesn't matter if everyone has matching napkins and you say it does matter. You better believe we will have matching napkins. When I feel like not going to the new stupid shit museum and you think that it is better than me sitting around the house on Saturday playing with my computer - you better believe my ass will be going with you to the museum and with a smile on my face.

You will also select my clothing when we shop. And I will obey, pay and wear it - whether I like it or not. You will pick out my cologne, my soap, my whatever, to meet your tastes.

Your task is to rule all of the things you can rule, by using my love for you against me, by teaching me shame for wrong-doing, by communicating what is in your heart - and whatever, without ever nagging, being a non-sexy bitch, emasculating me or smothering me. It's a fine line - but you must walk it.
I will enforce my power by giving you verbal commands to which you will obey. You will enforce your power by giving me the guilt/shame stare or the silent resolute, refuse to look at me stance - both of which usually will trump all my power. I respect your power, you respect mine.

If you are interested in your task as I am interested in mine - then please write me. Maybe we can negotiate something. Until I hear from you, I will be here earning and saving money for our future security as well as the gifts and the underwear I will be buying you, or the one who steps up if you do not. 

Please if it's not plainly obvious...include some relevant information about yourself (i.e. AGE height weight etc... and what makes you think this will work) with a picture. Thank you.

title: Sweet and funny looking for same
text:
I am 33 and a single father of 2 hope u enjoy what i have to say

Let's face it, I don't live the life of a rock-star or famous athlete ... but those guys are always getting caught cheating on their wives, so why would I want to live that life?

It sure would make writing this more entertaining, and reading it would be much more fun too. I could tell you about all the exotic cities and expensive hotels I've stayed at while being on tour. All the parties, clubs, alcohol and drugs ... it would make for a much more interesting read.

Maybe the rock-star lifestyle would be fun, but I don't want to live that life and a girl that's looking for that is not for me. While my story might be Rolling Stone worthy, I do work hard, pay my bills, enjoy the company of my friends & family ... while enjoying myself like I was a rock-star on tour.

Family and friends are most important to me in life. I've learned that money and opportunities come and go, but your friends and family are always there to help you when you need it. I hope one day I can pass down those qualities to a family of my own, and it's why I work so hard today.

I fully don't expect you to message me, I guess if I was getting 20 or 30 messages a day from people I wouldn't have to. Unfortunately real, honest guys like me often get passed over because we don't stand out among the hundreds on here trying to find a date by auto-blasting e-mails they have stored up on a hard drive. But if you're one of the few that are reading I'm looking for someone like you.

That's me in a nutshell. If I contact you, I appreciate you taking the time to read this and would love to get to know you more because most people don't get this far

title: Whispers!
text:
I whisper in your ear how I would touch thee, not with my hands, but with my heart. I want to deliver you worldly passions, and cosmic gasms. I want to pick your mind of the hidden pleasures, and explore your deepest fantasies. Till our own definition of love is universal. I want you beyond need, I yearn for you, all of you, your touch is of silk, your taste is of honey, your gaze breaks the seal on my soul, your scent brings me to a mountain sunrise, I can hear the passion carried in your voice, and you can hear on my every heartbeat my love for thee. 

As I search through this sad world of lost hearts and damaged souls, hear I lend my words of truth. We have the potential to be more than just animals, we can choose to be human. 

My promise is to your soul, if we are meant to be.

title: Man With His Stuff Together Looking To Date!
text:
Ladies, I know there are a lot of losers on here that make it tougher for you to trust everything you read. . . I know there are the men that are looking for mommies and women to take care of them because they have no job, no car, no place of their own. Or the ones that dry beg, oh, I'd like to take you out but I'm broke, or I don't get paid for a few days, or can you pick me up, my car broke down!?

Since anyone can say anything on here regardless if its true or not, I'll spare you the normal silliness. I know someone isn't going to fall in love with me based on some stuff I write before really meeting me and seeing for yourself? And if anyone did fall in love with me from something I wrote (even though I am a writer), then my red flags would go up and I'd be very leery about going on a date with that person?

Ladies, I know there are a lot of losers on here and I'm not one of them. Please read with an open mind and not have your guard up about some of the losers posting on here. . . I'll try to keep it simple to hopefully help you decide if you want to email first, then maybe text/talk and then if we both feel comfortable to maybe meet for lunch, dinner, movie? Then at least we can then meet and worse case scenario have a nice time with someone new? Dating now adays has become sooo complicated and people tell their entire life stories on here and make up way more stuff than needs to and it confuses everything!?

That being said, I'm a successful businessman with my own home, own vehicles, toys, time and resources to be able to take you out on nice fun enjoyable dates without expecting something in the end. . . I know we all know in our minds what we want and what we're looking for. But really, I don't have any expectations of meeting my soulmate on here. Not that I'm against it if it happened, but I know its unlikely.

So all I'm looking for is a great gal that enjoys others, life, doing nice things with a nice guy. And if thee gal and guy enjoy each other's company after a few dates, then maybe doing other nice fun things? Things like being wined and dined. Taken to the movies, go on long drives. Go to a live concert, event, comedy club, even spa days for some mani-pedis (yes I enjoy them also). 
And if we're able to enjoy each others company during those things, then maybe we can then go on weekend trips? Travel trips? Adventures, etc. . . But of course all of the other things are irrelevant without first speaking, meeting and then going on the first date if were simpatico?

Maybe I didn't simplify as I thought? But there you have it. . . All I'm looking for with this ad is to hopefully meet a great gal that would like to respond so we can have some dialog and see if we should meet for a date?! That doesn't mean we'll get married, or I want to have children with you or that you have to meet my mom. . . All those things that everyone seems to mention on here is always after many dates & premature to even mention to so many people that we don't even know?

So you know what I'm expecting from this ad, simple, dialog, if simpatico date? And we can figure out the rest from there.

Hopefully all you're looking for at the moment is a guy that can afford to take you to a nice restaurant and not have to pay with change. A guy who's looking to enjoy your company even if we may not be soulmates. A guy you can have fun with even though we might not fall madly in love within the first few seconds of reading each others words?

Hopefully you found this a little funny and entertaining? It wasn't meant to offend anyone. So if you'd like to know more, shoot me an email with a pic and ask anything you'd like and I'll do my best to answer.

Happy searching. . .

Me

title: Gabby
text:
Gabby....I know you were only looking for sex and attention, I get that, but we had an amazing connection, and I know you felt it too. I know your past is complicated and I know you are unsure of what you want right now, but let me tell you something. I want you so bad, more than friends, more than what we had the first few nights we hung out. Sure, the sex was amazing, and so was the kissing...but there was something more. You know how I know? I know because I felt it. I felt it when you called me, I felt it when we were close, I felt it when we were having sex. In fact, you started calling my baby and babe first over the phone. Telling me how I saved you, I know you weren't just saying that to make me feel good, you said that because it was the truth. We met at a time in our life when we needed each other the most...I needed to shed my loneliness, and you needed someone to give you love and attention. Not only did that happen, but more came out of it. When you went away to California, you constantly called and text me, and I loved every moment of it. I was always happy during texts and phone conversation. I know you were happy too because I could hear it in your voice.

I know that you are unsure about what you want in life right now, you have a past to deal with, but don't let that past affect your present and future. Gabby, I want you as more than a friend. I want you as a life partner. I know right now isn't the right time, but the possible future that we talked about, can happen. You owe it to yourself to give me an opportunity to make your life as happy and as loving as you deserve. You deserve someone who treats you with love and respect, and I am that man. I know you probably won't see this as you don't really go on Craigslist, but if you happen to see this...call me.

title: Great Gal Needed to Date - Travel - Live on Boat in Carribean...
text:
Ok, here goes... 
I'm a successful businessman who was in a very long relationship. I worked very hard to get my life to this point where I can live on a boat with someone special in the Caribbean and just Island hop for a year or longer??? Live the Real Dream!! The Vacation Life!!

Obviously the gal I was with didn't work out in the end, so now that I'm single, I'm not giving up on my dreams and goals!!
