So I'm looking for a great girl that loves life! Is happy! Motivated! Unattached! Can Leave Everything! Nothing Holding Her Back! Can be Gone for Months at a Time! Etc...

I'll be direct for the sake of saving both of our time... I apologize for coming across as selfish, but I'm ready to start this new adventure and need someone that matches a lot of this criteria since this will be a great adventure for both of us and not something of the norm...

The gal that will join me will obviously need to have an amazing adventurist spirit. I don't think a regular gal that doesn't have courage to take this kind of leap would be able to handle something like this? But who knows?

I'm looking for someone who... Gee, it's hard to put in words for something like this? So I'll just start throwing descriptive words out...?
Attractive, Fun, Happy, Exited, Loyal, Dependable, Honest, Motivated, Sexy, Romantic, Spoiled, Loving, Compassionate, Sexual, Free Spirited, Goal Oriented, Non Attached, No Baggage that cant be left behind, Spontaneous, Courageous, Strong Willed, Adventurous, Exited, Appreciative, Hopeful, Energetic, Introvert, Extravert, Hard Worker, Contributor, Loves Travel, Loves Ocean, Loves Life, Dreamer, Go Getter, Healthy, Doesn't Hate Men, Still Believes in Love, Truthful, Still Believes in Romance, Committed, Wants the Good Life, Willing to Work for the Good Life, Contribute to the Good Life, Brings Something to the Table, Good Moral Compass, Ethical, Has Something to Offer the World... There are more, but that should give you an idea?!

Most importantly I'd like to have the special woman who joins me to know the greatest adventure in life is life itself and who wants to live it to the fullest and never take it for granted!!!

I guess I can go on and on... But hopefully this is a start?

Ok, my turn on what I bring to the table. Of course I bring everything that I mentioned that I'm looking for as well. 
But what I also bring is the resources necessary to achieve this dream. Once we've met & dated and become close to each other to know that we'd want to have each others company... 
Part of the challenge that most would have with this type of adventure is money! I know everyone has bills and such. I'd pay for all your bills that you cannot consolidate. I'd cover all expenses! You wouldn't need to work, other than helping me with some of my businesses that are providing us the finances to live the vacation life!

Ft. Lauderdale or South Florida would be our home base... We'd have a home there and a boat slip at a marina. We'd also be coming back to Colorado throughout our travels. I have family & business here as I'm sure you do as well.

We'd be exploring and Island Hoping to the Florida Keys, Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, Cuba?, Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands (St. Thomas, St. Croix, St. John), British Virgin Islands (St. Marteen, French & Dutch, Tortola, etc..). My goal would be to explore the entire Caribbean!!
Then again, this is the Vacation Life, so that goal could and most likely will change. We'll just pick a place we both want to go to, and once were there, we'll stay or leave depending on how we like it! So we might stay a week or few weeks on a particular Island? or we might stay a day or two if we don't? This is an adventure and other than having fun and living the dream, we won't have many other rules we'll have to live by?

Hopefully I've been able to paint a picture as to what I'm looking for and to what the adventure should entail?

If you're seriously interested, please email me with information about yourself and if you match what would be necessary for this type of life experience. Also include a few photos of yourself. And of course, please ask any and all questions you have regarding me, the trip, or anything else.

I look forward to hearing from some amazing ladies!!!

title: Tantra Is the Science of Transforming Ordinary Lovers into Soul Mates
text:
"In the East, we have developed a science: if you cannot find a soul mate, you can create one. And that science is Tantra. To find a soul mate means to find the person with whom all your seven centers meet naturally. That is impossible. Once in a while, a Krishna and a Radha, a Shiva and a Shakti. And when it happens it is tre...mendously beautiful. But it is like lightning -- you cannot depend on it. If you want to read your Bible, you can't depend on it that when the lightning is there you will read. The lightning is a natural phenomenon, but not dependable. 

"If you wait for your natural soul mate to meet with you, it will be just like waiting for lightning with which to read your Bible. And you will not be able to read much either. For a moment it is there, and by the time you have opened the Bible it is gone. 

"Hence, Tantra was created. Tantra is a scientific approach. Tantra is alchemy; it can transform your centers, it can transform the other's centers, it can create a rhythm and harmony between you and your beloved. That is the beauty of Tantra. It is like bringing electricity into your house. Then you can turn it on and off whenever you want. And you can have a thousand and one uses of it; it can cool your room, it can heat your room. Then it is a miracle. These seven centers in you are nothing but centers of body electricity. So, when I am talking about lightning, don't think of it only as a symbol -- I mean it literally. 

"In your body, there exists a subtle current of electricity, very subtle. But the subtler it is, the deeper it goes. It is not very visible. Scientists say that all the electricity that is in your body, if put together, can be used to light a five-candle bulb. It is not much. Quantitatively it is not much, quantitatively the atom is not much, but qualitatively. . . If it explodes, it has tremendous energy in it. 

"These seven centers, these seven chakras Yoga and Tantra have talked about down the ages, are nothing but five knots in your body electric current. They can be changed; they can be rearranged. They can be given a new shape, form. Two lovers can be transformed so deeply that all their seven centers can start meeting. 

If this resonates with you please let's talk

title: A Certain Kind of "Crazy"
text:
I've always been confused when my guy friends call certain girls "crazy". I mean, sure, there are some genuinely crazy people out there (of all genders), but, in my experience those women that men so easily discard as "crazy" are nothing more than human girls expressing themselves. I happen to enjoy that rainbow kaleidoscope of emotions and I'm seeking a woman of that ilk. I mean if you like microwaving butterflies for fun, then we probably wouldn't get along. But, if you get a little nuts, sometimes for no reason at all, well... read on.

I'd prefer an emotional woman. Why? While I've been single for a while now, I'd much prefer a woman who is emotive and passionate. I'd prefer to live my life with a partner who would rather suck the marrow from the bones of life than sit around passionless, watching reruns of House.

Does this mean skydiving after work and non-stop go, go, go? No. I don't necessarily need someone who thinks she has to "keep up" with me. After all, many nights you'll find me with my nose in a book sipping something red. Hmm... as I'm typing all of this out, I'm finding that it's harder to explain than I imagined. So... here's a little about me.

I'm in my 40s, gainfully employed in a creative field, and I look the part (pierced ears - tastefully, longer hair, etc.). I love music and go to tons of concerts. In the summer I try to hike every week. I'm in good shape and hygienic (which, why should that even be a question? C'mon get it together, guys!). I'm an attentive listener, insightful when it's appropriate, and curious about people and eager to learn to new things about myself, my world around me and the people in it.

title: Ironically I am giving this a shot
text:
Hello,
It is ironic when you sit in front of the computer and get amazed by the postings on CL, not in a judging way, yet sit and read and know deep inside me that it is not my thing, despite the fact that I can feel a connection and I can relate to what a lot of people say. That being said, I have never though that I would be putting an ad on here, and again here I am, I bet a lot can relate to that.
I am a phoenix, I did rise from my own ashes, I am stronger than ever, wiser than yesterday and I am a believer that I have a great mission in life and that to help others and create a healthy surrounding for the people I interact with, even after I am not on this planet I am working on leaving a legacy to be used by others.
I am looking to meet someone and share my future with, build a legacy, a healthy life style, enjoy what life has to offer and accept each other for who we are and who we are not.
Do I have an ideal woman in mind that I would love to build a relationship with, yes I do mentally, emotionally and physically.
Mentally : I am looking for a woman who is balanced, educated, diverse, socially attentive, have the capability to bring audience to their knees, a city woman, yet doesn't mind a crazy adventure every now and then. Sophisticated yet get things done, appreciate being a lady yet will step up when needed, balanced between leaning on her man and walking beside her man. understands that tango is for two people not one. If you do not have kids or kids that are grown that would be ideal, I am not opposed to having kids, yet I want to focus on building a relationship with the person I want at this time.
Emotionally: someone who is not afraid to express how they feel at anytime, no matter what it is, it can be communicated, can handle a blunt honest person, emotionally vulnerable "believe me it is a strength not a weakness", self confident and is trustworthy.
Physically: I am a sucker for Red-heads, gingers, athletic/fit, healthy, take care of her self both physically and he appearance, 5'8, between 35 and 45 years of age, again that is my preference, and I know life doesn't usually give us what we want.
If you are still reading here is a bit a bout me
I have been divorced for 2 years, I have been on dates "I am not out of touch in this area" yet I am tired of all the fakes and the people that want nothing but party, don't get me wrong I love having a good time yet there is time for play and time for business.
I do have kids I have them half of the time, they live in a different state with their mother, and hence mentioning earlier I would prefer if I meet someone without kids or with kids that are grown.
I do have a job and I do own my business as well. I am very laid back, diverse, well traveled, well educated, multi-lingual, very social, extrovert, I enjoy deep intellectual conversations, I am a very passionate person, comes with my culture of origin, I am bi-racial and both are family focused and passion oriented, lets say I am a great lover, dominant in the bedroom. 
I don't smoke, I don't drink and I never did drugs " I dont mind if you do as long as you are not addicted and no hard drugs am ok if you are 420 oriented" , I had it all and I lost it all and again I am a phoenix rising from the ashes.

Should you be interested to answer after this long boring post, I would be honored to hear from you, please change the title to "legacy" so I know you are real, I would appreciate if you include a picture of you, I will not reply to an email without one, I want to know who I am talking to, and I will respond with one back.

If you read this post and still think that it is not for you, then I wish you all the best in your endeavor, I hope we all find happiness and gratitude in what life offers.

title: READY SET GO!
text:
"Seeking a man that's at least 7 feet tall. I like to wear high heels" -- Damn, totally boned here. I'm only 5'9 or maybe 5'11, apparently equaling "somewhere between midget and elf, and therefore undatable", even though the average American male height is 5'10. And 6 feet tall? What kind of shoes are you wearing anyway? Some shit from the lunar landing? Next. . .

"Must love animals" -- Great. . . You mean I have to pretend to like your floofy poodle/chihuahua/norway rat mixed breed long enough to maybe earn some kisses? Or that huge mastiff that's physically capable of kicking me out of your bed? How about the cat that's contemplating using my balls as a scratching post every time I walk around in my boxers? I think I'll exit stage right before the fucker eats my socks again.

"Looking for a God-fearing man" -- I get the biggest kick out of this one. Why would you be afraid of your own imaginary friend? Seems like you'd better imagine something a little less hostile. I'd suggest Papa Smurf.

"Must like the outdoors" -- Barring a select few dweebs I've met that live in their parents' basement and mainline Mountain Dew so they can play World of Warcraft for 87 hours straight, most human beings like being outside at some point. Sure, I'll go for a day hike with you. Does that mean I want to live in the woods for a month and wipe my ass with a pine cone? No thanks!

"Looking for friends first" -- Cool, I'm always down for more friends. Wait, what's that you say? Your hot friend Brittany is single? Excuse me while I ask her for her phone number.

"Must love children" -- Unlike the mighty lion (who will kill and eat cubs from rival males) I say the more kids, the better! We can open our own sweatshop and they can make you shoes. I call being the manager!

"I like having fun" -- Whew, what a relief! I'm meeting too many people these days that think having fun sucks. I'm a big fan of fun myself! We have so much in common.

"Must like to dance" -- Really? Have you ever met a straight guy that wants to go dancing? Wait, I take that back. I do know one guy, but he's from Puerto Rico or something. Come to think of it, he's probably gay. That's right, Jorge -- I've got you figured out.

"I like going out, but also enjoy staying in for a quiet night at home" -- That's great, because staying home or going out and doing something are pretty much the only two options you have.

So in conclusion, I say the luck of the Irish be with you lovely ladies of Fort Collins in your search for a badass Daniel Craig-era James Bond lookalike that will dance the Macarena with Mr. Cuddlekins the Poodle whilst purchasing you an all-expenses-paid vacation to Maui. Just keep in mind that Mr. Bond is only 5'10.

title: Challenger witness in school, on TV? I'd like to talk.
text:
I was a witness to it live and in-person. It had a huge impact on me, and not in a good way. I have a lot of melancholy today......

I was a young engineer, very recently out of college, brand new to the aerospace industry, and so excited about it all. It was the second live launch I saw. One normal one, then the Challenger.....

I've wondered often through the years.....what was it like for so many school kids watching on TV, live at school, because of the teacher that was on board?

It was a huge shock to me, of course, but what the investigation revealed was so very disappointing to me. Being not long out of college, it was my introduction to the corruption that can exist in the real world - and it was a whopper of one.

So I would like to meet and talk with some people who were in a classroom or auditorium somewhere, watching with lots of other school kids around you. I expect you will be 10-15 years younger than I am, and I'm interested to hear thoughts of people that were of high school or middle school, or even grade school age at the time.

Just looking to chat and perhaps meet some people who were affected by it. Yes, we've gone on with our lives, but it was a big event that stayed with part of us. Looking to share thoughts, feelings....just talk.

title: So, Women, why do the good guys finish last?

Why do Women say these things? Why can't you just tell us good guys what you're really thinking and be up front, instead of beating around the bush?

Do you like to be treated like shit? Do you like being abandoned? Why do Women keep going back to their ex's who treat like them garbage? I just don't understand how you could possibly go back to someone who didn't appreciated you in any way. 

You know those really good guys who are there for you anytime you need them? You know, the ones that talk to you when no one else does, the ones who come to you when you want them to come over just so you're not lonely, the ones who would do anything for you? title: Down to you
text:
Everything comes and goes
Marked by lovers and styles of clothes
Things that you held high
And told yourself were true
Lost or changing as the days come down to you
Down to you
Constant stranger
You're a kind person
You're a cold person too
It's down to you
It all comes down to you.
You go down to the pick up station
Craving warmth and beauty
You settle for less than fascination
A few drinks later you're not so choosy
When the closing lights strip off the shadows
On this strange new flesh you've found
Clutching the night to you like a fig leaf
You hurry
To the blackness
And the blankets
To lay down an impression
And your loneliness

In the morning there are lovers in the street
They look so high
You brush against a stranger
And you both apologize
Old friends seem indifferent
You must have brought that on
Old bonds have broken down
Love is gone
Ooh, love is gone
Written on your spirit this sad song
Love is gone

Everything comes and goes
Pleasure moves on too early
And trouble leaves too slow
Just when you're thinking
You've finally got it made
Bad news comes knocking
At your garden gate
Knocking for you
Constant stranger
You're a brute-you're an angel
You can crawl-you can fly too
It's down to you
It all comes down to you

title: I am looking for mutual alchemy and my cheerleader....
text:
I'm looking for mutual alchemy and to be each other's mutual cheerleader but I think it's has to be mutual not one way.... 

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.
4) An attitude of mutual reconciliation and a desire to makes things work

I'm looking for someone:

* who supports my career vision and allows me to support theirs
* with whom I can grow with and change together
* who shares my values (family, moral, others)
* who reminds me that I am not my accomplishments nor my degree(s), not my paycheck, not my job title, and especially not for my inheritance (I don't have one btw)
* who loves me for who I am 
* who remembers that it's important that we love one another not because of what we have done but because of who we are
* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together
* with whom I can adventure through life with as we grow and change, and with whom I can create something beautiful, extraordinary, and sometimes hard to explain
* who has no or minimal emotional baggage
* who understands that honest and constant communication is key to a successful, strong relationship

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same. No age, race, or other barriers though I'd prefer if you are in the 18-33 age range.

I recently moved to Los Angeles from the east coast but I'm in the Denver area frequently for work. I'm willing to move there or anywhere for the right person so please don't let the distance be a deterrent to exploring if we might be right for each other.

I look forward to hearing from you.

title: A Veritable Prince Charming
text:
ABOUT ME: A True Renaissance Man. A veritable Prince Charming. The most well-rounded, profoundly well-cultured guy you will ever meet.
Ladies, Tired yet of lop-sided male egos? One trick ponies largely incapable of the empathy and flexibility to want to engage the genuine you, learn with you and from you, shared experiences with you in a more authentic love and affection . . . where you come first? What's the benefit to you? I'm all guy when and where I need to be, yet not afraid to engage the more feminine virtues --patience, empathy, half-a-lick of humility, and not at all afraid to say I'm sorry or apologize if I'm at fault for something.
I have a very present boyishness that's nonetheless quite mature. I've been called 'Prince Charming'. A well intentioned word of warning --I am addictive. I am cute, smart, healthy/fit, creative, serious yet playful, focused, hard working, dedicated and loyal and know how to please. My art, design, and creative/music talents are everywhere around me. Business wise I'm in interior décor --all women, customers mostly women. And yet I'm solid masculine where and when I need to be --strong, decisive, a leader and teacher. I do volunteer substance abuse counseling. I've sponsored children overseas through Save The Children, and currently support FINCA, which gives small start-up business loans to impoverished women in third world countries. Get it? Profoundly well rounded, genuinely well cultured. I have a music degree, am a certified masseuse and professional nurse part-time.
I am good with women in the best of all possible ways, and will dote all over you. My overall demeanor is hip, suave, classy (think actor Richard Gere, only cuter:) A former yoga mag model.
Intellectually brilliant . . .try me. I am a published western authority on Yoga; just signed a book deal with Random House/Xlibris to publish the most important work on Yoga in a generation ... ever partake?
Overall it's been an incredible journey of cultivation, learning, and discovery --a few disappointments- but overall accomplishments across the board --yet unlucky in love. Nonetheless, I'd like to find Ms. Right for the rest of the journey. I've spent my entire adult life cultivating all good and noble things and now with fewer distractions I'd like to settle in with a fabulous lady for mutual growth, learning, sharing, security. If anything of this opportunity resonates with you I'd love to hear from you.
Much love and God bless.
PS. As much as so many women have acknowledged their purported interests in new adventures, new experiences, and new avenues of learning I continue to be startled by the small minded filters and biases in place when women encounter the likes of fabulous me. The tenuous economic environment appears to prompt many to go looking for financial incentives, yet should teach you just the exact opposite --quality of life is not and cannot be found in money --but quality and richness of character- which means I am unequivocally one of the most endowed individuals you are ever likely to meet, guaranteed. Someday some fortunate (ie, open minded and open hearted) lady will recognize this opportunity and decide to place her hand in mine and thank God and her lucky stars for the day she decided to do so. And lastly, many women will be as yet too immature to appreciate and give proper value to this, but this guy is one who you should want to grow old with. This one's a keeper:)
FYI: two non-starters: no smokers and no fundamentalists.

title: One last time, then I quit.
text:
Greetings

Just a few lines in attempt to break down what I'm ABOUT. Well, I'm a 40 year old biracial male, originally from Chicago but raised in San Diego. I'm quite proud to lay claim to that city. I've lived in Denver three years now and I have to admit that I dig it here. The town offers pretty much all I need in regards to city life but the escape to the mountains is the major plus, as I love the outdoors and feel so much better as a human when I'm out in nature. I am a writer/poet/performer and have a life-long commitment to the arts. I've enjoyed many good times and people, and I strive to enjoy more.
I have an amazingly beautiful eight-years wise daughter. She is my everything and all. Our connection is inseparable. I've learned incredible lessons due to her, and I am a much better and stronger person because of her. 

I'm an empath. I feel people's pains or energies, negatives and positives. That can be a rough existence at times so I make it a point to surround myself with positive, creative, family and community-minded people. 

So, yeah. What about you?

I'm looking for someone healthy/fit, creative, intelligent, attractive, sensual, graceful, caring, enduring, and able to be a positive influence to my lil one. Someone down to create beauty in all forms. 

Im just a regular guy maneuvering the obstacles.

I must say this, though. I smoke herbs. If you have any personal dislikes or issues with it, then its highly unlikely we'll match up. 

Well, whats next? Where does all this lead to? Reach out to me, send a pic. Share something.

title: Looking for a long term FWB
text:
Hi there! So if you're one of those people just browsing through the creep-tastic posts here for a laugh, I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to disappoint you-- I'm actually a moderately normal person. I know, I know. It's crazy, but normal people do occasionally post to Craigslist. Though it's kind of like the myth of the honest politician. They all claim to be, but only a tiny fraction of them truly are. It's up to you to figure out who to trust, who to be suspicious of, and who to impeach for lying about a blowjob in the oval office. Though I suppose that last one is only mildly relevant.

So why is a normal person posting here? Well thanks for asking, anonymous peruser of casual sex personals! Honestly, it's because I'm a very quiet person. I'm not shy, I don't lack confidence, I'm not uncomfortable around people, but I just tend to keep most things to myself, which makes it rather difficult to meet people. In addition to that, I'm also very perceptive, very empathic, good at reading people's thoughts and emotions, sensitive and communicate much better physically than I do verbally, whether it's with a touch on the arm, a kiss on the neck, or a hand around the hips.

I only started having sex pretty late (comparatively) in life-- Just a couple years ago. And it turns out those qualities I just listed seem to make me fairly decent at it. However, I tend to be pretty single-minded about things I like. I don't settle for being good at something, or even great at something. If I enjoy it, I want to be the best at it. I've learned a lot about intimacy and physical fulfillment in these last two years, and want to keep learning more. Unfortunately that whole quiet thing I mentioned makes it rather challenging to meet new friends. Hence, back to why I'm posting on Craigslist.

One thing I've discovered is that the better you know someone, the better the sex tends to get, so ultimately I would be looking for a real friends-with-benefits thing. But of course there's really no way to know if you're going to click with someone physically until you start exchanging fluids, so if it doesn't work out, no big deal-- Promise I'm no stalker. (Back to that whole trust thing...)

As for the mundane stats and such... I'm 29 years old, 5'11", lean, athletic build. I put effort in to my appearance, I hope you do too. Just ask for a picture and I'll be more than happy to send one.

As far as age goes-- It's not really a thing to me. You could be 18 or you could be 48 as long as we've got a real connection. So if you're in a similar situation as me, or if you can just sympathize with what I'm saying, get in touch. We can exchange a few emails, maybe some texts, meet for coffee, and take things from there. I'm not in any rush to jump right into bed with a stranger, I suspect you're not either. ;) Please put the name of your favorite season in the subject line, so I know you're real. Be awesome!

About me: I am 33, (will be 34 in a couple weeks), average built, non smoker (of anything and you must be too), non drinker (an occasional drink or glass of wine here and there), d&d free and plan on keeping it that way. I am a disabled vet. I served in the Air Force as a Police Officer for 6 years as my first career path till I was medically discharged. Since then, after a few government security jobs, I learned Audio/Video and was an A/V Tech for a church for another 6 years. I also continue to do freelance work for a tv studio and other A/V installs occasionally. I have now returned back to school full time and I am in my first semester at MSU pursuing a degree for Computer Science. 
I do have 3 kids from my first wife, a daughter who is 16, and two boys that are 14 and 12. They live in Illinois and I get them out here for a month during the summers, other than that, I am all alone except for my dog. I do NOT want more kids of my own and have also taken precautions to make sure such things don't happen. If this is an issue and you think you may want one or more later on, then I'm not your guy, sorry. I am not opposed to the fact that you may have your own.
I love the outdoors. I love to go hiking in the mountains. I also have a Trailblazer that I have extremely modified for off roading and love to hit trails whenever possible and especially shooting. I love to fish or just go for walks on a nice calm evening. One of my biggest woo-saw's (stress reliever, for those that don't know what woo-saw is), is listening to Zac Brown Band on a quiet evening sitting at my fire pit. I love to laugh and make people laugh. I am more of the shy type at first unless I get to know you or am around friends and company I am comfortable with and love to be a clown and become the entertainment. 

What am I looking for: That's a good question, I thought I had what I always wanted but that turned out to not be the case. Someone that is close to my age, mature (but has a good sense of humor and a goofy side), non-smoker (this includes mj!), no drugs of any kind, non, or light social drinker, and preferably not a mouth your mother would be ashamed to listen too. Also, I am not into bbw's, I'm sorry, but big girls are just not my type. You don't have to be skinny, average or a little extra is perfectly ok, I am just not attracted to bigger girls. 

I am not looking to jump straight into a serious relationship with the words of marriage being flung out next month, but I would like to meet some nice friends and see where things go. If all of this sounds like something you feel you could match up to and/or would like to know more about, please at least say hi and don't be shy. I would love to hear from you. Good luck out there.

title: Sharing small things done with great love
text:
Family is more than kids and uncles and aunts and nieces and nephews. Family is connection. I'm in the 3rd quarter of my life. It's not over yet, not by a long shot - yet I want to create a new family for this part of my life.

I don't know about a great love for the ages, or soulmates. Who even knows what those are? In my experience it's not about big things anymore. For me it's about small things done with great love. That's what I want to share. Whether its planning dinner or an evening out. Whether it's working together with others to make Denver a better community or just a trip to Home Depot to fix stuff around the house. Whether it's planning the next trip to Europe or just walking the dog.

title: ...When The Stars Align
text:
I love it when the proverbial...Stars Align...don't you?
Whether it's being in the right place at the right time, luck, fate sometimes (at least in my life) wonderful things have happened, things that make life better just because. Do you know what I mean?
Meeting the "right" person. Dating, relationships, seem to be often work in the same way. In other words, sometimes when you least expect magic, it happens! Going to absolutely put Craigslist and internet dating in that same general category. Not expecting much, yet still hoping for some magic :)

Will magic happen if we have absolutely nothing in common? Probably not. So here's some random thoughts that may possibly strike a chord with you? If they do, hope you'll send me an email, maybe even a picture too? 

I like to make jokes, often inappropriate ones. Activity, working out, staying fit is my religion. Smoking disgusts me as does ridiculous traffic and those stupid guage things people put in their ears. Food and drink is never an afterthought, cooking delicious meals together, going out to great places, drinking wonderful beer and wine together is something we'll do very often. Mutual attraction is certainly comprised of many things and the physical part is super important. Jeans are always appropriate attire. There are many benefits to monogamy. Romance happens. I do not "feel the Bern" and never will. Dogs, woof! Android. Money is important and cool stuff is much more fun than the lack thereof. Travel is awesome, happily I have the time and resources to do more of it. Intelligence is sexy, so are great abs. Church is not somewhere I go on Sundays. Witter banter is more important than great sex. Just kidding, but the two are pretty awesome when combined. 

You can tell a lot about a person in just a couple emails. Nonetheless, endless emails are pretty boring. Let's be spontaneous, exchange a couple and make plan to grab drinks together. Pretty simple stuff right?

title: FLR Primer
text:
Time for a relationship change? 
How about a change of perspective on what a relationship can be - and should be. 
Maybe you'd prefer a man on your terms - one who is eager to please and attentive to your needs. 
Such men exist. I'm one of them: devotional, deferential and proudly submissive. 
Women routinely reject deferential, devotional and eager-to-please men out of ignorance rather than insight. They mistakenly believe men, who happily defer to strong women, are inherently unworthy. The reality is, we're quite the opposite and offer an alternative to the pervasive machismo endemic in our patriarchal society. 

What does such a relationship entail? As an unapologetic, 'card-carrying submissive male' - who has been in a number of FLRs (Female-led Relationships) - I have some insight into what makes men, like me, tick. 

Interested in learning more? I've composed a thoughtfully-written female-friendly primer on the topic and am happy to share a link (without any expectations or follow-ups)

title: Jewish Boy 43 for Jewish Girl
text:
I am going to do my best to lay my feelings out as best as possible. You may look at it and say there is too much but realize everyone has their issues but few are willing to put them out right away.

Sorry if this is long but I do hope you read the whole thing. I do get to a point eventually.

I never know what to say. Here I am trying to pique interest with a 5 or 6 word heading and a post that someone actually wants to read and reply to. I am intelligent, quick witted, have an excellent vocabulary, and can even be eloquent and yet I still dont know the formula here for getting the right responses. I guess I will just go with some of the basics and hope that someone decides they want to know more.

For starters, I am 43, live in Englewood, 5'8", 215lbs, dark hair and eyes

Guess I should also note here I was a smoker. Using an E-cig. Slip off for about pack or 2 every month or so. So don't take this as a "I quit"

I am the divorced dad of 2 children. They are my world and reason for living but I don't get them often enough which kills me. Not sure if there is a correlation but I do have an affinity for single moms.

I am considered attractive but beauty is different to everyone so I guess that is meaningless. Will be happy to send a picture and let you decide for yourself.

Why am I writing an ad? Great question if I do say so myself. Here it is.....

I am tired of spending so much time alone. I miss having someone to call when something good or bad happens. I hate not having someone to text in the middle of the day to just say "hi, im thinking of you". And I loathe going to sleep and waking up alone (although my laptop does keep me company its not the same).

I got divorced 7 yrs ago and I was over it in days of her filing. Please don't think this to mean I didn't care about the marriage. I was completely dedicated to my marriage but as soon as she decided she wanted a divorce she became evil and malicious. The fight still continues because she manipulates the situation using the kids as pawns and that's the only thing I care about, my kids, Yes, this means I have some baggage and I will not apologize for that. I will fight to my last breath for my kids.

I cant tell you why but I have been stagnant as far as committing to a relationship. I know that's a weird way to phrase it but what I mean is I get involved in relationships that just dont go anywhere. I think it is because I knew from the beginning they weren't the right one. Its almost comical that I pursue these relationships that wont go anywhere. Part of my issue is I try to help and end up trying to be the savior and that never plays out well cause I end up feeling disrespected and used.

Now I know I am ready. My mindset has started to change and I feel I am ready for something real, something equal, something worth holding onto.

title: Faith
text:
I didn't arrive at my faith by going to church and being told how it's done. Back then, no one taught me much. Instead, I took a bumpy ride through many challenges, then concluded that faith contained the meaning I craved. 

Years ago I thought meaning had something to do with geography, so I bounced around quite a bit. Then circumstances made me stay put. The journey turned inward, and I saw things never found on the road. At this point, it's clear that I would have to share these beliefs with a true connection. 

I'm tall, fit, healthy, happy and grateful. I'm 47, and no one ever guesses that. I go to my job in the day and the gym at night while looking forward to a business risk shaking that up soon. Regardless of what I have, I'm single and alone but have a growing capacity to give and love. I work on my dreams, so I'm confident they will all happen. Being adventurous, handy, creative and a little out there, I can see myself living on a sailboat or based in a rural place. Somehow, I feel more alive near water. Denver is alright, but there's a whole world out there. 

I'd like to find a connection for the journey. It makes so many things better wherever we are. Someone who fits would find peace and meaning in faith. She may not have all the answers, but she spends time seeking her truth. She's healthy, active, free, curious and smart. Not strict or restricted, but she does the right thing and keeps her morals in check. I imagine a magnetism that seems inevitable. Together we are equally curious and excited about life.

title: Older Man 4 Younger Woman!
text:
I'm an older man looking for a Long Term Relationship/Dating with an attractive young and fit woman. This may sound weird to many of you, and may not be your cup of tea, but please don't delete my posting just because it's not for you. I was married to an older woman, she had kids, and we had a few together, but she didn't want to join in any family activities. All she wanted to do was sit around and watch TV, and she nearly sucked the life out of me. Maybe it's because of her that I seek younger women; I don't know, but all I know it's now what I want.

I am attractive (been told I am quite handsome), fit (I love to stay active and workout daily) although I still have a few extra pounds, and I am quite intelligent. I am 6' tall, and don't shave any parts of my body except my face lol. I don't have any tats or piercings. I don't mind if you do, I know they are just not for me. I'm very, very traditional. I believe the man should open doors for his woman and treat her with courtesy and manners (all women actually), and watch my language around women, and children.

I was in the Marines for 10 years and got out as a Captain, and am very Patriotic. I don't believe in big government and am very adamant about keeping my Constitutional Rights. I mean that's what I served my country for 10 years for; "To Support and Defend the Constitution of the United States of America". Every Commissioned Officer takes this Oath of Office. I am also conservative and believe in the Right to Bear Arms.

I believe it's the man's responsibility to protect, defend, love, and provide for his family. I am not against the woman working; however, as I am all for it. I also believe in communication at all levels. I am very upfront and speak my mind, but I don't yell or scream and am not abusive. No need for that. I have a Degree in Business Administration and am very good with people. I get along with everyone, but am not one to be taken advantage of. I believe communication is the main ingredient in keeping a solid relationship. 

If you are a younger woman that is tired of the way "boys" your age treat you, perhaps you need a change in your selection of the opposite sex, a real "man". I am I guess what you would call an "Alpha Male". I am not controlling; however, I am a great leader. If you are tired of fighting life and relationships and would like a strong man to lead you, give you sound advice, and give you emotional support and encouragement, then I may be right for you. I am a "One Woman Man", and am looking for a "One Man Woman". I don't cheat, and don't expect you to either. I love sex, and would love a younger partner who would want to let loose and be open to experimenting, but only with each other. If you are inexperienced in that area, I would love to teach you and we could reach new sexual heights together. If I piqued your interest and you are still reading, perhaps you should reply. 

I don't mind sharing pictures, and will do so with anyone who would like to. In saying that, please don't just reply asking me for a pic. Tell me something about you, and what you are looking for. Please put your age in your reply. Prefer someone 40 or younger. 

I know this is long, but I hope at least one woman who is still interested responds. I hope to hear from you soon, and I hope everyone of you has a great day!

One last thing: If you are curious about an older man, but never acted on it, why don't you give it a try?

title: Seeking 420 girl for live in situation

This property is located between Florence and Wetmore at the base of the wet mountains, mostly in the woods with a few open areas. Lots of wildlife around. Unfortunately you cannot bring your pets here. Unless it's something small in a cage or aquarium. No dogs no cats, it sucks but that's just the way it is..
It's pretty isolated and the dirt road to get here is rough and rocky in some spots.

One thing I should mention is visitors/ friends cannot come over, you'll have to meet them somewhere or go to their place... The less people who come here the better. 
This arrangement can be worth your time in so many ways. I can't really pay you much for the first few months but towards late September/October and November your hard work will really pay off... 
I understand this isn't for everybody, the whole no friends over and no dogs/cats can be deal breakers for a lot. But I know there's someone out there who will fit in perfect.

If this piques your interest contact me with any questions or concerns you have. 
I'm an Mmj patient and prefer that you are too but if you aren't we can get you your card. 
If you're wondering I'm a single man in my early thirties.

title: CAN'T SLEEP. UP LATE THINKING...
text:
. . . how crappy my love life is and how women aren't into nice and stable guys. Yes this is probably going to turn into a rant and I'm going to say things I wouldn't normally say, but I really need to get some things off of my chest. I'm the type of guy who keeps things bottled up since I don't have anyone to vent to so maybe there is someone out there who is reading this.

I am 26 years old and have only been in one relationship. She was one of the few women I have felt a real connection with. We dated for 2 years and never fought. She cheated on me after we moved in together and it just killed me how she could throw all we went through together like it was nothing. I mean I was going through the worst time of my life and it didn't even seem to phase her. 5 years have past and nobody has shown the slightest interest in me. I mean I have an athletic build and wouldn't say I'm terrible to look at. I am intelligent, athletic, have a great job, good sense of humor, am very respectful, and am a genuinely nice guy.

Post breakup, I got to the point where I felt content being single. After you are single for a while, it really starts to wear on you. I mean when you go out to the store or any place for that matter, why does everybody have to be in a relationship? I feel like I'm the only one who hasn't really dated and it isn't for a lack of trying. I got so lonely that I have tried pretty much every online dating site over the last 5 years. I have sent well over a thousand messages and out of those, I have probably only gotten responses for 7. Out of those 7, I only went on 1 date that didn't lead to anything else. I bet few women know what it is like to feel like you are constantly being rejected. You get to the point where it hurts so much that you give up trying. I could normally bring myself to feel a little better about being single, but then I started the whole process over again. That is I get to the point where I can't stand being single, go back to trying online dating, feel like I'm constantly being rejected, and go back to convincing myself being single is a viable solution. I think to try to cope with this I started to spend a lot of money on myself. I buy nice things for myself because I feel like I'm the only person who could possibly care for me. I don't know if that makes any sense or not.

Lately I haven't been able to convince myself being single is okay and it is killing me. Maybe it is because I moved in with a few roommates and both of them are constantly having sex and it reminds me how crappy my love life is. I mean I think everybody needs physical contact with the opposite sex and I just have never had luck in that department. I mean I have only been with 1 woman and it has been 4 years since I have had any physical contact with anyone. I can't stop thinking about making out, cuddling, and having sex with someone probably because it has been so long. I'm getting to the point where I am so sexually frustrated that I really don't know how to cope anymore. I'm not the kind of guy who wants to have a one night stand either. I want a real, long term, committed relationship, but can't seem to find one.

I'm really starting to wonder if anyone has/is going through a similar situation or if it is just me.

Well if you are still reading, you are probably the only one! I would love to hear from you. Put "Frustrated" in the subject line so I can weed out spam and tell me about yourself and why you responded.

title: Are You MARRIED and thinking about placing an ad BUT...
text:
You don't want to deal with the hundreds of replies that women often receive. Most are from perverts, weirdos, druggies, crazies, con artists and who knows what. Finding a needle in a haystack is a cinch compared to finding the guy that is safe, sane, fun, and discrete who knows what you really want and need. Let me try to save you some of that hassle and risk... 

I am guessing you have been married or in a relationship for a long time. The romance has evaporated. Passion - what's that? Hell, even the sex is routine if it exists at all. You are more like business partners or roommates. But there are so many responsibilities and obligations... 

You long to feel noticed, appreciated and respected for all you do. You need to feel wanted and desired for the intelligent, sexy, sensuous woman you know you still are. A bar pick up or one night stand isn't you. Sure you miss the kissing that makes your toes curl and the great sex but it isn't just that. You miss the deep connection, the comfort, the affection, the sharing, the feeling of being excited and of being able to arouse a special someone that you want to please. You want to relax and laugh and be happy and free at least for a private moment. You would love to feel warm and anxious with anticipation of our next message, call or meeting. You want to be a woman who is alive. 

I understand and share these feelings and longings. I, too, find myself in 'that' kind of marriage. I am also not willing to risk everything on a cheap fling but rather seek a very special, intelligent, mature woman who has considered an adult friendship and a lover. I am Caucasian, active and in good shape. 

I don't expect many replies to this ad but all I really need is the right one. If this message has resonated with you, do us both a favor and answer me. We may not connect but isn't it worth a try? Send "married" in the subject line so I know you aren't a bot, or spam...

title: Looking for another intelligent person
text:
So, I am simply incompatible with dating sites, to start. Match.com? Give me a break. Does every single person on that site appear in one of their commercials? Is that place not truly a repository of headshots attached to vapid personalities? And then OKCupid was supposed to be where all the fellow geeks convene, but it turns out it is also the choice hangout for women who all coincidentally have a father in the hospital whose uncertain fate is always mysteriously most dire every time you are about to actually meet.

Losing faith, I resort to desperate measures for affection, like that BP site. Just know that if you are of African descent, you have not a snowball's chance at a frickin' KKK cross barbecue up there, what with the appalling wall of "NO BLACK MEN" one encounters. You'd really think you've entered a timewarp to the 1920s looking at crap like that.

I've even tried more "legitimate" companionship services like Denver Ladies, which has interesting individuals, but doling out hundreds of dollars for a few hours of companionship is depressing to even think about.

So, who am I looking for? Someone who likes to learn, enjoys watching interesting videos and reading interesting literature, and even talking about it from time to time. Someone who like video games, especially of the RPG variety. Someone who actually plays such things, by the way, and would consider any of the above activities actual enjoyable things, rather than something pleasant to mention in a profile.

I only say this because I like to talk about what we're reading, and I tend to produce a lot of text--a tendency I'm still weighing whether or not is a vice or virtue. But make no mistake: if this is too much text, we will not sync up.

I should stress that I am NOT looking for simply a friend. I am specifically looking for a sexual relationship as a man seeking a woman.

Also, I do not have kids and would prefer to meet someone who does not as well.

If you've made it this far, great! Someone who does not like clubbing or bars, and prefers hanging out at a quiet place, like a living room or café. Someone who likes porn and is into sex. Someone who identifies as either a Philosopher, Artist, or Writer, in that order of preference. In short, someone who actually values the life of the mind and enjoys watching movies and documentaries.

title: Take a look, and see what you think.
text:
Now then, where to start.. I guess I'll start with a little about myself. Physically, I am a Caucasian male, with a lithe physcial build, brunette hair, green eyes - and as I've been told, very "kissable" lips. I consider my sense of style, or absolute lack thereof, as pretty typical for a guy my age. Not to say that I look like a train-wreck, mind you.. I prefer the label "hot mess". :P

In regards to my personality, I'm a pretty relaxed - and lighthearted guy. A bit nerdy, being a bookworm and all that. I admittedly have a darker, more sarcastic sense of humor; but as of yet, I haven't met a person that I didn't get along well with. I tend to consider my more outstanding traits to be my absolute belief in loyalty before all else - the continued survival of chivalry - and being genuine, no matter what may come of it. I have a small group of friends I'm very close to, and my family means a lot to me. I'm not afraid of my emotions by any means, and I'm definitely not the shy type. I'm what you'd call a social drinker; I've never smoked, and I've never been married - nor had any children. I like to spend my time listening to drum and bass music, playing video games (in moderation), painting, reading (I always have my face in a book), and going out with my close-nit group of pals.

What I'm looking for isn't your typical relationship, admittedly, but I think it's something that others can easily identify with. I crave physical affection, and emotional intimacy, as much as the average male longs for sex - possibly more so. Now, that's not to say I don't have a very healthy sexual appetite - because I certainly do. But what I want is to have it to take a backseat early on. I want to take my time to get to know you. I want to cuddle together and watch movies; play board-games in bad weather; talk for hours each night - but also be able to enjoy a comfortable silence with you. I want to just savor the healthy aspects of a relationship, without all of the drama and needless pressure on "where this relationship is going". Now, that isn't to say that I'm not looking for something lasting, because I certainly am. I'm not the least bit afraid of commitment. I'm hoping that said relationship would become something more, but I also don't want to rush things.

Now, what I'm searching for in a girl, is the very things I pride myself most on. Loyalty, a big heart, and a moral compass that isn't compromised when things get tough. I want someone who is genuine - someone who's real, flaws and all. Physically, I've never considered myself shallow, so I don't have a set "type", but that's not to say that I'm not somewhat picky. I mean, admittedly, I do prefer Caucasian females; and I'm also a sucker for large, lovely eyes. But that's about it really in the way of preferences.

I know what you're thinking. Sounds too good to be true, right? Why is he single? Well, I recently broke out of a very long relationship - and am only now in a position where I want to begin "dating" again. Only, lets face it, typical dating sucks. So I figured, maybe, just maybe, there was a girl in a situation like myself.. looking for something more.. something different. Now, to be perfectly clear - if I haven't been enough - this isn't a "friend with benefits deal", or the like. There seems to be some confusion about that when I posted last time, so I figured I'd try and clear that up right away. I am looking for a long term relationship. :)

I will send several pictures of myself to those interested; I'm just a bit wary of pic collectors on Craigslist. Oh, and please put your favorite color as the header of your email, and a facial - so that I know you're real, and not illiterate. I will not respond to emails that ignore this part, as I'll just assume you didn't care enough to read the ad, or you're a bot. Both are equally bad.

So, if you're still here with me, and I sound like someone you'd like to get to know, shoot me a message. I look forward to talking with you soon. 

(I'm very real, the weather was windy and cloudy today.)

title: MARRIAGE WITHIN THE YEAR
text:
Maybe I'm being a little too forward, but I want to be married within the next year. I am sick and tired of what dating has come to these days. I don't know when things changed from having meaningful relationships to having one-night stands, but this generation disgusts me. Do people respect themselves anymore and actually care to get to know someone before having sex? There must be something wrong with me because I believe in having as few sexual partners as possible. That seems to be the opposite of the norm. 

I would consider myself one of the more intelligent individuals out there, but dating baffles me. I just can't understand how dating has evolved into its current form. Putting our generations desire for instant gratification and casual sex aside, online dating has changed the way people date and not for the better. Women get hundreds of messages and get addicted to meeting new people. They have a phobia of settling down because they have a plethora of unopened messages and either are hooked on the thrill of meeting new guys or believe someone better is waiting in the unopened pile of messages. Here is an article that sums up my online dating experience over the last several years (search google for "online dating sucks because of women like me"). It has been a frustrating journey and I am sick of this generation. I am a great catch and one of the few genuinely nice guys out there who gets passed by because women don't know a good thing when it is right in front of them. People are more interested in dating around than developing a meaningful relationship like in the decades past and online dating has encouraged this destructive behavior. I'm hoping someone is out there who feels the same way and who is willing to break the cycle with me.

What I am looking for in a partner:
Intelligent
Athletic (weight is a deal breaker for me)
Great Career
Has her own interests
Does NOT want kids
No older than 35

About me:
Engineer
Always trying to better myself
Athletic
Respectful
Puts other people before myself
26, but mature beyond my years

I guess what I'm looking for is a woman I would consider my equal. Someone who has everything she could want career-wise, but is just missing a special person to share her life with. Someone who knows relationships are hard work and who is willing to fight for it to succeed. I want someone who is ready for a relationship and who is looking to settle down (i.e. get married within a year or so). I mean getting married is not necessary for me in the next year, but being in a committed relationship is. I'm rambling at this point. If by chance you are looking for similar things I would love to hear from you. Put "I do" in the subject line, tell me about yourself, and include a picture.

title: Looking for a functional loser
text:
I'm looking for one of my own, a functional loser.

What does that even mean, you ask?

Well, it means that on the surface, my life is great.

I have a good job, that pays really well, that I"ve been at for over a decade.

My co-workers and boss' really seem to think I'm great and pretty much let me be my own boss.

I own a house with a reasonable mortgage. I have no debt.

I have 2 cars. I have a good group of friends.

I have all the toys and gadgets I could ever want and the money to buy the new ones that tickle my fancy.

Im very fit. I run 4+ miles each day of the weekday at a 7:30min mile.

I'm tall. Health is good more or less.

Life is good. On the surface.


But really, I just feel like a loser.

I'm lazy. I'd rather just go home and play a game or smoke then clean the house.

Or have an adult beverage and veg out on the internet.

Im a bit jaded by online dating and have a hard time putting a lot of effort forward unless the other person makes it clear that I should. Basically, my flirting game is nonexistent. Im also scared of rejection so the easiest way not to be rejected is not to put myself in a situation where that's an option.

I love to sleep in when I can and often, when I am able to, I am let down by myself because I've wasted so much of the morning.

I'm pretty hard on myself. I often think I don't perform well at things or try hard enough. That im not good looking enough. That I don't make enough money.

Im asocial. I have a small group of friends that I make sure I keep up contact with, one or two I see with some frequency, but it's hard for most people to get into the inner circle.

I don't have a focused interest in.... anything. You know how some people love cooking, or gardening, or dancing, or raising a family. I mean, they REALLY love it. Well, I don't have anything that I REALLY love to do aside from maybe games. I think Im more of a hedonist where I really just love pleasure (relaxing, games, sex, vacation, good food, etc). Maybe I really love exercise but.. I don't. I just like the byproduct of it.

I don't particularly like my job. I feel in over my head. Knowing this, I still have 0 drive to go back to school to learn a job that I would love, because in can't think of anything I would love doing. Like I said earlier.

Sometimes I just feel stressed. Just from living.



So yea, that's me. A functional loser.

Would love to find a female functional loser, or someone who would want to date one.

I could either use the guidance from one who isn't, or the enabling of one who also is, or maybe something in the middle.

title: Are you out there? Please find me!
text:
Unfortunately I have found myself at the end of a relationship. If you have been there, you know how that feels. I am trying to move on and keep trucking. 

About me: I am 33, (will be 34 in a couple weeks), average built, non smoker (of anything and you must be too), non drinker (an occasional drink or glass of wine here and there), d&d free and plan on keeping it that way. I am a disabled vet. I served in the Air Force as a Police Officer for 6 years as my first career path till I was medically discharged. Since then, after a few government security jobs, I learned Audio/Video and was an A/V Tech for a church for another 6 years. I also continue to do freelance work for a tv studio and other A/V installs occasionally. I have now returned back to school full time and I am in my first semester at MSU pursuing a degree for Computer Science. 
I do have 3 kids from my first wife, a daughter who is 16, and two boys that are 14 and 12. They live in Illinois and I get them out here for a month during the summers, other than that, I am all alone except for my dog. I do NOT want more kids of my own and have also taken precautions to make sure such things don't happen. If this is an issue and you think you may want one or more later on, then I'm not your guy, sorry. I am not opposed to the fact that you may have your own.
I love the outdoors. I love to go hiking in the mountains. I also have a Trailblazer that I have extremely modified for off roading and love to hit trails whenever possible, and especially shooting. I love to fish or just go for walks on a nice calm evening. One of my biggest woo-saw's (stress reliever, for those that don't know what woo-saw is), is listening to Zac Brown Band on a quiet evening sitting at my fire pit. I love to laugh and make people laugh. I am more of the shy type at first unless I get to know you or am around friends and company I am comfortable with and love to be a clown and become the entertainment. 

What am I looking for: That's a good question, I thought I had what I always wanted but that turned out to not be the case. First off, if anything was to lead toward any kind of a relationship, you must be faithful and trustworthy. (Trust and faithfulness is a big deal to me and I will not compromise.) Someone that is close to my age, mature (but has a good sense of humor and a goofy side), non-smoker (this includes mj!), no drugs of any kind, non, or light social drinker, and preferably not a mouth your mother would be ashamed to listen too. Also, I am not into bbw's, I'm sorry, but big girls are just not my type. You don't have to be skinny, average or a little extra is perfectly ok, I am just not attracted to bigger girls. 

I am not looking to jump straight into a serious relationship with the words of marriage being flung out next month, but I would like to meet some nice friends and see where things go. If there is a connection and it leads to more, I would not be opposed to it at all. If all of this sounds like something you feel you could match up to and/or would like to know more about, please at least say hi and don't be shy. I would love to hear from you. Good luck out there.
